job_descriptions.e478b356032e70fd:
Who We Are:

Cardinal Financial is a nationwide direct mortgage lender whose mission is to prove that homeownership is possible for everyone. By bringing an open-minded approach to an often closed-minded industry, we're able to embrace every unique financial situation differently in order to craft the best possible loans for our borrowers. We pride ourselves on providing excellent service backed by our groundbreaking technology, and these two components of our process come together to complete a simple, personalized mortgage experience. But it all starts with our people.

We believe that no matter where you fit in our organization—Sales, Human Resources, Information Technology, or even re-stocking the break rooms with endless coffee supplies—everyone can influence the experience that we provide to our customers and our partners. We tell our customers and our partners that anything can be reimagined. So why not your career? Looking to join a company that values its people, innovates and expands on its proprietary technology, and is growing at a ridiculous rate?! Apply below!

Who We Need:

We are looking for a Junior User Interface/User Experience Designer (UI/UX Designer) to design web application interfaces for software and web-based platforms that make doing business with Cardinal Financial, easier—through great design. You will combine your knowledge and passion for design flows and experiences that are simple, elegant and intuitive. As a Junior UI/UX Designer, you must possess the aptitude to understand the capabilities and needs of campaign landing pages, intranet web platforms, websites and support the Sr. UI/UX Designer. Our goal is always to build modern interfaces that support the brand message and increase usability.

If you have a strong visual aesthetic, strong communication skills, a can-do attitude, and are looking for a high-energy environment that celebrates design thinking and customer experience — consider joining our team!

What You Will Do:
User flow and information architecture experience is a must.
Strong proficiency in modern design software such as Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Adobe XD and Zeplin are a plus..
Ability to design out wireframes and take wireframes to a high fidelity prototype.
Conscious ability to think and challenge mobile-first design for complex web applications with the ability to decipher the needs of each screen.
Collaborating with designers, developers, and engineers to create intuitive, user-friendly software excites you. You are not the type to operate in a silo and welcome creative feedback and much as you welcome technical feedback.
Possess a well-rounded understanding of information architecture and a willingness to help re-architect information if necessary.
Understanding branding, marketing, and business strategies is a must.
Project management and time management skills a must.
What You Need:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
1-3+ years of UI/UX design work experience, preferably including technical products for both technical and non-technical users (IT, software engineers, developers, etc.).
Experience creating wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, and clickable prototypes is a must.
Experience in information design and data visualization, with a demonstrated ability to clearly express complex information.
Experience performing user research, user mapping, and presenting results.
Experience using web analytics data to inform design decisions.
Remote applicants are strongly encouraged to apply.
A strong portfolio of work showcasing your design process.
Bonus Points:
Experience working in an Agile environment
Working knowledge of CSS/ HTML/Javascript (Tailwind CSS)
Experience with Prototype tools (Adobe XD, Invision, etc.)
Comfortable using a variety of different tools (Zeplin)
What We Offer:
Strength, Stability, and Vision.
An empowered culture where your ideas are important and your voice matters.
Opportunity for career growth.
Competitive compensation package.
Benefits that become effective the first day of the month following your start date including - Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and much more…
401K w/ 50% match up to a maximum employee contribution of 5%- Effective the 1st of the month following 30-days of employment.
Back Apply Now

job_descriptions.fc39c317487b3f4a:
Job Description:
Our creative consulting firm client is looking to bring on a remote, freelance UX Designer to help support a project:

Start = end of Sept / early October
Duration = 4-6 month with possible extension
Remote, freelance

The UX Designer in this role will work on websites and/or web and mobile applications.

At least 3-5 years of experience working on UX for websites and/or web and mobile apps is required.
In-house experience is highly preferred as well.

Visual Design chops are a nice to have, but this is a UX Design role.
Experience working with developers is highly preferred

Deliverables: Wireframes, Prototyping, Design Documentation.
Tools: Sketch, Adobe Suite or Sigma

Phases/Hours: Our projects have three phases- we see this freelancer working 20 hours/week during phase one (conceptualization) which could last 8-12 weeks, and then 40 hrs/week during the next phase (productization)- about 4-6 weeks. The third phase is building & optimization which could be handed over to the client to complete, otherwise that would be a 40 hour/week phase as well.

job_descriptions.e4c4c10941d1ab32:
Summer 2021 UX designer Internship - (20001152)
Description

Company Overview
The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America® helps protect families, secure futures and improve well-being through insurance and wealth management offerings for individuals, employers and businesses. Our ability to always put our 26 million customers first is driven by our 158-year heritage as a mutual company committed to serving the long-term needs of our policyholders. With approximately 9,000 employees and a network of over 2,750 financial representatives in 55 agencies nationwide, the entire Guardian team is passionate about advancing innovation, service and knowledge to help build strong families and communities for generations to come.
Internship Overview
Our Internship Program is a paid 10-week learning experience where you will be immersed in the daily environment of a thriving Fortune 250 global financial services company.
You will gain invaluable industry and organizational knowledge through daily business interactions and job assignments, in addition to engaging in projects that directly affect our business, interact with senior leaders in conversational settings, and network with employees and interns across our regional offices.
Position Summary
Do you want to be part of a collaborative Customer & Digital Experience team?
Are you a problem solver who enjoys using data and research to build better consumer experiences?
Are you excited by design challenges and possess good interpersonal skills to effectively liaison between technical and business teams?
Do you think big and enjoy learning new ways of working, hands on work and opportunities to lead change?
Is a culture where “People Count,” “We Do the Right Thing,” and “We Hold Ourselves to Very High Standards” important to you?
If so, Guardian is seeking a User Experience Design Intern to assist with design, communication, planning, and research efforts involved in transforming Guardian to a consumer-centric organization.

Qualifications

You are

Currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelor’s degree in UX Design, Interaction Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Human Factors, Engineering Psychology or related program
A self-starter who is fueled by a desire to improve customer experiences in the moments that matter most, approaching your work with a bias toward accountability, decision-making and action
Inquisitive and creative, with an ability to listen to identify customer needs and dig deeper to understand the reasons behind those needs
Able to transform conceptual thinking into deliverables that generate excitement, feedback and alignment among stakeholders
Thrive in a collaborative environment, partnering across the company with business experts, software developers, data engineers, and marketers
You have

Enthusiasm to take the initiative to tackle problems and work with others to expand on your experience and expertise
Working knowledge of agile development practices, human centered design and/or UX design practices
An aptitude for visual storytelling and user research
Experience with Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch or similar tools used to visualize digital experience
You will
Work closely with and learn from UX designers and user researchers to contribute to a variety of deliverables, including presentations, wireframes, storyboards, low-fidelity prototypes, polished designs, HTML/CSS, research plans, questionnaires and surveys
Location
Remote work from home with potential to travel to office in New York, NY or Holmdel, NJ.
Our promise
Through skill-building, leadership development and philanthropic opportunities, we provide opportunities to build communities and grow your career, surrounded by diverse colleagues with high ethical standards
Guardian has been helping people protect their futures and secure their lives for more than 150 years. Every day, we serve approximately 27 million people through a range of insurance and financial products. As one of the largest mutual insurance companies, we know what matters most: putting the needs of our customers first. Because everyone deserves a Guardian. Learn more about Guardian at guardianlife.com.
Guardian is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, marital status, disability, military or veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Primary Location: United States-New York-New York
Job: Internship
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: Day Job
Job Type: Internship
Travel: No

job_descriptions.6e7e92b00e22f75f:
UX Product Designer

UX Product Designers at Madewell play a key role in defining the user experience and design of digital features on Madewell.com. This role will collaborate closely with other UX Product Designers, Brand Creative, and our Digital Insights team, and will report into the Director of Product Development.

We're looking for someone who has exceptional attention to detail and a passion for creating useful and innovative online retail shopping experiences. The ideal candidate has broad experience in the areas of wireframing, UI design, information architecture, prototyping, and user research.

Specific responsibilities include:

Own the iterative product design of major ecommerce features
Own customer journey mapping and documentation as the site evolves
Participate in user research, identifying key pain points and strategies for solving customer problems
Participate in sprint planning and roadmap discussions
Collaborate with Product Management on requirements and specifications
Partner closely with Creative teams to design delightful customer experiences
Partner closely with engineers to see designs through on all devices and touchpoints
Communicate ideas and concepts clearly and concisely, tailoring the content to the audience
Manage multiple projects and competing priorities in an agile environment
Leverage site analytics to identify opportunities to improve the site experience
Interpret business needs, objectives, and direction from multiple stakeholders and integrate feedback appropriately into the product experience

Qualifications:

At least 1-2 years design experience with customer-facing sites
Proficiency using Sketch and Invision for design creation and clickable prototyping
Background in ecommerce and digital shopping experiences
Ability to take a project from ideation to completion
Knowledge of modern and emerging web and mobile UI patterns and design tools
Ability to communicate and collaborate on a cross-functional team
A great portfolio of work that demonstrates user experience and product design skills
We are committed to affirmatively providing equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, legally protected physical or mental disability or any other basis protected under applicable law.

job_descriptions.55a033c378f0293f:
Position Overview
Xaxis builds platforms for the future of digital media trading. We are seeking a talented UI / UX designer for CoPilot, our product enabling traders to leverage machine learning and automation to optimize programmatic media buying. You will ensure the workflows and interfaces reflecting cutting-edge, machine-learning technology are accessible, efficient, and fun to use.
A few things about you:
You emphasize experience in your interfaces, ensuring users’ paths through workflows are clear and easy to understand.
You strive for simple where complex would suffice.
You are passionate about design that is as functional as it is aesthetically pleasing.
You obsess over details but know when to compromise, consistently striking a balance between “pixel perfect” vs. “shippable”.
You enjoy the challenge presenting information, and have experience designing data visualizations.
Responsibilities
Set the aesthetic direction and design language for the product.
Ensure visual and design consistency throughout the UI.
Work alongside product managers and engineers to translate business needs into wireframes, flows, and UI mocks.
Prototype and iterate designs on whiteboards, walls, paper, or wherever else is effective at turning ideas into code that ships.
Qualifications
2+ years of experience as a UX, interaction designer or a similar role.
2+ years of experience with data visualization design in a highly quantitative environment.
Strong portfolio URL demonstrating visual and interaction design.
Experience with front-end programming (CSS, Javascript, React, Semantic UI) a plus.
Xaxis is a global digital media platform that programmatically connects advertisers to audiences across all addressable channels. Through the expert use of proprietary data and advertising technology along with unparalleled media relationships, Xaxis delivers results for over 2,800 clients in 40 markets across North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Latin America and the Middle East. Advertisers working with Xaxis achieve exceptionally high return on advertising spend through the company’s proprietary media products, as well as through its wholly-owned specialist companies, Light Reaction, Bannerconnect, and ActionX. For more information, visit www.xaxis.com.

Xaxis is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
job_descriptions.2940d59ee0756181:
We are The Motley Fool, a purpose-driven financial services firm with nearly 30 years of expertise. Our goal is to make the world smarter, happier, and richer by providing outstanding business and investing advice, at scale. But what does that even mean?! It means we’re helping Fools (always with a capital “F”) demystify the world of finance, beat the stock market, and achieve personal wealth and happiness through our investing services, like Stock Advisor, and Motley Fool Wealth Management, our portfolio management service.
What does this team do?
Our top-tier team of talented UI/UX designers work to make sure that our suite of premium product websites are responsive, accessible, and Foolish. Along with a team of frontend developers, you'll touch almost every part of the visual experience of our website, which operates at a huge scale of millions of users for Fool.com and over 750k subscribers for our premium sites. We are looking for people with solid hands-on work experience building beautiful, fast, and functional websites. You have a strong design eye, an ability to visually communicate ideas, and the technical chops to code up what you’ve envisioned
What would you do in this role?
As a UI/UX Designer you will be a driving creative force behind the design for Fool.com and related Fool Premium website experiences. You’ll use your keen design eye to create mockups and sharp technical chops to convert them to code. Our design system isn’t set in stone yet — this role will provide you with the exciting opportunity to be a part of shaping and building out our future design system and strategy.
But what does this role actually do?
Work with fellow designers to convert product ideas into low-fidelity wireframes for feedback and testing.
Leverage components in the pattern library and create high-fidelity mockups across different screen-sizes for further testing and development.
Convert design mockups to code that can integrate with the Fool.com or related Fool Premium website experiences.
Communicate the design decisions you’ve made, why you’ve made them, and ideally backing up those decisions with qualitative or quantitative data.
Translate designs in the Django code: pulling from GitHub, making HTML updates in the template, extending Bootstrap or adding new HTML and SCSS styles, adding interaction via JQuery, and deploying your changes to a feature branch.
Abstract reusable new design patterns and code components into shared items in Storybook and the Component Library.
We’d love to work with you if:
You design solutions: You hear the description of a user need or a product opportunity and can start sketching out how that could work. That you aren’t afraid to suggest approaches and then dive in to create them. You know when to go looking for input from others, and are constantly looking for ways to improve our user experience.

You are open to pivoting to solutions that better meet our user’s specific needs. You love getting user feedback and see it as a chance to enhance your designs so that they are more usable. You understand that user research can be a sort of visual editing that can help you learn, grow, and better serve our customers.

You pay attention to detail: Missed details erode consistency, makes users think, when we are aiming to build trust in our advice for how to invest their hard-earned savings. You actively pull in other team members to review your work and understand the value of thinking through each step in the user flow.
You love form and function. You know good design isn’t about bells and whistles. It’s about making a workable solution that meets the member’s needs.

You’re curious and love to learn: Whether it’s the latest technology, how the Foolish business operates, or investing for yourself; you have an insatiable appetite for knowledge. And, you love to share, engage and collaborate with your teammates.


You take pride in your work: The thought of a customer being lost in a product you designed makes you cringe. Hearing criticism in a user test actually makes you grateful to make the tool even better. You want to ensure that every customer has a great experience with The Motley Fool because of what you build.
What do you need to apply?
At least one year of experience in UI design and web development outside of a coding bootcamp or college program.
Ability to build responsive and accessible web pages – HTML and CSS
Ability to write server-side CSS pre-processing platforms – SCSS
A clear understanding of UI design patterns, responsive web design, and web accessibility.
Ability to clearly and concisely communicate with your peers.
Experience working on projects with multiple designers, developers, and stakeholders.
A desire to work with a fun, growing team of developers and design professionals.
If you have one, show us your online portfolio and share about the impact it has made. We look forward to seeing it!
It’s even better if you have…
Formal design training i.e. BA/BFA (or equivalent experience) in Visual Communication, HCI or a related field is a plus.
Ability to work with front-end website frameworks – Bootstrap
Ability to work with a javascript environment - Vue.js
Ability to work in a Python environment - Django
Ability to work with image authoring tools – Sketch
Familiarity with the opportunities and limitations of web typography.
Familiarity with vector graphics and iconography.
Familiarity with code versioning tool – Git
Familiarity with basic concepts of investing and finance.
The Motley Fool is firmly committed to diversity, inclusion, and equity. We are a motley group of overachievers that have built a culture of trust founded on Foolishness, fun, and a commitment to making the world smarter, happier and richer. However you identify or whatever winding road has led you to us, please don't hesitate to apply if the description above leaves you thinking, "Hey! I could do that!"
We have been twice named Glassdoor’s #1 Best Small Business to work for in the U.S., named to Inc.’s Best Workplaces of 2020, named one of BuiltIn’s Best Places to Work in Colorado, and we’re a perennial favorite on Washingtonian’s list of Best Places to Work year after year. Below you’ll see a few of our perks, but check out this site for the complete list:
No “vacation policy” (not to be confused with a “No vacation” policy)
Paid maternity, paternity, and pet-ernity leave
$1,000 to invest when you start
Super low premiums for medical, dental and vision coverage
Comprehensive compensation package, including company equity
job_descriptions.75687ad52d7dfa17:
LoveToKnow is looking for a Senior Product Designer to lead our word app & game initiatives as well as contribute to the company-wide mobile-first strategy across all LoveToKnow media portfolio companies.

Your portfolio should speak for itself. We're looking for a strong background in mobile app and web experiences design. You should have an infectious curiosity and the desire to understand our users' needs to ensure an engaging experience. We are a distributed team so you should be highly organized, a strong communicator, and be able to give and receive critical feedback asynchronously.

This role is highly collaborative and will put you in the heart of the product team working closely with fellow designers and researchers as well as engineering, editorial, revenue, data insights as well as directly with the leadership team.

Why you want this job:

You're excited to help define a user-focused strategy for the wildly popular WordFinder App!
You're not just comfortable but you thrive working in a remote and globally distributed culture
You're eager to create engaging and delightful mobile experiences used by millions
You have a solid blend of graphic/visual design with user experience/product design
You have an appreciation and understanding of A/B testing process and comfort using data to inform design decisions

Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for the end to end design processes including evaluating and prioritizing solutions for needs learned from user research., support tickets and bugs
Improve the overall design and launch quality by developing style guides, quality standards, improved processes,
Communicating user stories and needs through early-stage storyboards, sketches, wireframes, high fidelity mocks, and prototypes
Define, design, and deploy A/B testing concepts
Complete competitive analysis, evaluation of new market opportunities, and be a player of word games!
Facilitate global (cross timezone) brainstorming and collaborative design sessions
Make strategic design decisions as well as leading day to day operations
You will be leading the evolution of the WordFinder App brand as well as facilitate brand identity and style system for new apps and games.

Metrics for success

Increase user engagement and time in-app.
Work with our QA team to define testing standards to improve output quality and reduction in post-launch issues
Create a shared UI component library alongside our front end team and have it used by other products

Skillsets:

Fluent English communication skills - written and oral.
6+ or more years of experience and a proven track record in delivering high quality and engaging solutions.
Hands-on experience creating wireframes, interactive prototypes, storyboards, user flows, etc.
Proven ability to run user tests, customer interviews, and surveys.
Solid understanding of leading qualitative & quantitative research methods and a passion for connecting with users on a regular basis at all stages of the design process.
Strong presentation skills and comfortable working in Google Slides & Docs
Portfolio to be presented and discussed during the interview.
Experience using tools such as Sketch, Abstract, Adobe Creative Cloud, Miro

MakerBot is looking for a UI/UX Designer to join the product team in Brooklyn, NY. You will be working across all of MakerBot's 3D printing products to design and shape our user experience, including our digital products MakerBot Cloudprint, Thingiverse, onboard printer interfaces, and more. You will be the advocate for the user within the product team. We're looking for candidates who are passionate about design, thrive on tackling complex technical challenges, and eager to venture into uncharted design territory to shape the future of 3D printing.

In addition to these core competencies, we are looking for someone who enjoys learning new skills and working with the rest of the design team in defining + developing a unified design and brand across hardware, software, packaging, website, and marketing content.

Basic Qualifications

Experience collaborating with multidisciplinary teams of Designers, Engineers, and Product Managers throughout the design process; creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes.
Experience designing across multiple platforms.
Portfolio showcasing multiple projects that demonstrates designing usable digital interfaces, and relevant user flows.
4+ years of relevant industry experience.

An expert in Sketch or Figma and Adobe creative suite.

Design Team Skill Set

Infectious spirit of creativity and innovative thinking
Strong visual, written, and verbal communication skills

Experience with 3D printing, modeling, or CAD design.
Skills in communicating and influencing product design strategy.
Experience working with IoT ecosystems.
Excellent problem-solving skills and familiarity with technical constraints and limitations as they apply to designing for platforms such as desktop and mobile (i.e. Android and iOS).

Software

Bonus Software Skills: CAD (Solidworks, Rhino, Alias, etc), Adobe Premiere / Flash / After Effects, Keyshot, Programming

Weekly virtual, after-work yoga.
Access to 3D printers, of course, but also helpful people who love sharing their knowledge and expertise to help and teach you how to use them.

This is an on-site, full-time salaried position located in our Brooklyn office. The compensation package includes health, dental, vision benefits, pre-tax benefits for transit, 401K matching, and three weeks of vacation. This is a great opportunity to make a big impact in a unique industry working with amazing people.

MakerBot, a subsidiary of Stratasys Ltd. (Nasdaq: SSYS), is a global leader in the 3D printing industry. MakerBot's connected 3D printing solutions address the wider needs of professionals and educators, evolving their ideas from inspiration to innovation.

Your Team responsibilities
We are searching for an experienced UX professional to join the global team developing MSCI’s next generation financial platforms. Our teams are based in US, Europe and Asia. This position, located in New York, is part of the MSCI UX team and will report to the UX Lead in New York.
You will be responsible for building strong relationships across Design, Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Research, and create an engaging, seamless, effective user experience. In this role, we expect an analytical and creative UX professional who is able to grasp user needs and solve problems based on Lean UX Methodology.

Competitive fixed and variable compensation, holiday/vacation allowance & retirement savings plans/pensions

MSCI is a market leader in Global Indexes, Smart Beta, ESG and Risk Management, and is at the forefront of the secular trends dominating the financial services landscape today. job_descriptions.2313d27d534b3d3c:
WHO ARE WE?

Vestwell believes that all Americans should have easy access to a retirement account, which is why we've created a digital platform that makes it simpler to offer and administer 401(k) plans. We have built a digital-first platform designed to reset the bar to power a $30T industry.

Our focus is to build the most flexible, powerful workplace savings and investment platform, delivered through the hands and minds of our financial services partners with the help of payroll providers. We make the hard stuff look easy, by combining the expertise of financial advice with the sophistication of a technology provider.

As a result, financial advisors get to provide the advice and solution that employers and employees have been asking for, while growing and scaling along the way. Employers get a cost-effective solution design for their needs without the headache, and employees get a user-friendly portal that helps them achieve their long-term saving goals.

WHY VESTWELL?

With backing from leading Fintech investors, as well as a growing team of dedicated professionals of strong industry pedigree, Vestwell is at the forefront of a much-needed change in a 40-yr old industry. Our team believes in the mission we've set out to achieve and we're working hard to get there. We're ambitious, honest, thoughtful, and fun.


OUR CULTURE


We take a modern Agile approach to web development, trusting cross-functional squads to make bottom up decisions in terms of roadmap prioritization, technical choices, and day-to-day processes.

We want squads working as a team to define their roadmap and prioritization, that follows best practices in development, automation testing, deploying, and support.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

The design team is seeking a junior-mid UX designer with 1-2 years of experience. You should be comfortable with the many facets of the UX design process, including root cause investigation, research synthesis, brainstorming, wireframing, prototyping, usability testing, and the fundamentals of visual design. You will define your own approach to problem solving in a complex space while delicately balancing the needs of the business with the needs of our users.

You're a great fit for our team if you can thrive in detail-oriented tasks as well as supporting the team in defining future product direction.

Most of all, you must be passionate about what you create and about the impact it can have. That matters to us a lot.


REQUIREMENTS

Necessary Experience
Comfort with Figma
Working with other designers, PMs, engineers, and business stakeholders
Presenting your research and design to project stakeholders
Communicating professionally (both written and verbal) with users
Designing responsive web apps from desktop to mobile viewports
Researching with interviews, surveys, and data analysis from event tracking
Wireframing, prototyping, and usability testing your prototypes
Creating storyboards, site maps, and other design artifacts
Nice to Have
Degree in HCI, interaction design, or related field
Experience in a small company with a fast-paced environment
Familiarity with HTML and CSS


BENEFITS

We're a growth stage startup with lots of exciting milestones ahead. We value health and wellness at Vestwell and, as such, offer competitive health coverage and an open vacation policy. We also have a bright, comfortable office with lots of workspace options in midtown Manhattan so you can be as productive as possible, and we hope to be back there once we've beaten this virus. In the meantime, we provide the team with all the equipment they need (plus a few perks) to work effectively remotely. Oh, and naturally we have a great 401(k) plan!

job_descriptions.c75905231c8a7b99:
Packet, an Equinix company, is looking for a User Experience Designer to be a major contributor to our bare metal cloud provider software products. This person will focus on making our customer and employee web experiences awesome! We need a generalist who puts users at the center of every project, thinks strategically and iterates with speed.


This role can be remote.


What you’ll be doing:

You'll have a key role in all aspects of the design process. We'll utilize your expertise to build brand-new experiences and iteratively improve existing ones. Daily responsibilities include conducting user research and designing low fidelity mockups. You'll build prototypes and write test scripts to run user testing sessions. Once we've finalized designs for a feature, you'll facilitate the developer handoff and handle troubleshooting. Most significantly, you will evangelize design thinking across our organization, and define design standards at Packet. Today we use Figma, Zoom, Jira, Slack, G-Suite and FullStory, and we are always on the lookout for new tools.


What we’ll expect from you:

5-8 years experience designing experiences for enterprise and cloud products
Enthusiasm for collaborating with our engineering teams, product, designers and partners.
A strong affinity for UX standards, with a balanced amount of understanding that compromise is imperative to get things done.
Effective communication and presentation skills to stakeholders and executives.
Flexibility and a strong desire to continue learning new skills and tools
An interest in bare metal hardware and networking-focused products. We don’t expect that you are a specialist in this industry, but be able to demonstrate your ability to wrangle complex processes


About Packet:

Packet, an Equinix company, is the leader in automated bare metal. We focus on making infrastructure a competitive advantage for the world’s leading digital businesses by pairing developer-friendly bare metal with a trusted ecosystem of networks, software, and partners.

Packet helps customers take advantage of Equinix’s unmatched geographic reach in 55+ global markets, 340k+ interconnections between over 1800+ networks, and a neutral approach with automation that creates a trusted, friction-free experience. As part of Equinix, our mission is to protect, connect, and power the digital world with physical infrastructure that moves at software speed.


Interested in our mission? Please follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn or reach out about open positions. Learn more at www.packet.com/.


Packet is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Packet, we constantly strive to build an environment that allows our employees (Packeteers) to do the best work of their lives. Our team works remotely in 10 countries across the globe. Packet is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all backgrounds. We do not discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have specific needs during the process, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we are happy to accommodate! Please note that benefits vary by country, if you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ask.

Job Title: Consultant (Primary Role: UX Designer)

THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION

PLEASE NOTE: THIS POSITION IS CONTINGENT ON APPROPRIATE CONTRACT AWARD. IT IS NOT AN IMMEDIATE OPEN POSITION.


The So Company is looking for a Consultant to join our growing team that provides UX design services to federal, state, and local government agencies and private sector organizations. This opportunity is for a disciplined, flexible, and empathic consultant whose primary role will be working as a design researcher. This consultant will help build our practice by helping clients improve service delivery and/or organizational change projects. The consultant is interested in working on service design challenges and has the ability to work remotely and in distributed teams.

About The So Company:

The So Company is a growing services consulting firm headquartered in Brooklyn, New York, with team members spread across multiple states and the District of Columbia. Since 2014, The So Company's teams have supported federal, state, and local government agencies and private sector organizations by helping improve services delivery, for example, improving usability on HealthCare.gov for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, and VA.gov (formerly Vets.gov) for the Department of Veterans Affairs.

Who you are:

The ideal candidate demonstrates strong design skills focusing on user experience. Human-centered insights and a deep understanding of company/client organizational culture are critical to how we do our best work. This includes experience interacting with front-end engineers and technical product managers and taking input from both leadership and peers. Designers help the Program Planner and Product Manager to deliver the best products possible for our client.

Who are we looking for:

An individual contributor in The So Company is a member of a team and not just a writer, editor, content strategist, designer, researcher, or software engineer. While we look for candidates who are specialists in their fields, the right candidate excels in a team with various skill sets and abilities and will often be asked to perform duties outside of their core role. They are able to work in environments that highlight not just their unique skills, but also their problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Our work is frequently presented to the most senior US government officials, such as the United States Senate, House of Representatives, and Executive Office of the President.

Key responsibilities:

Report and work under Design team in day-to-day design duties and documentation
Assist in creating low-fidelity to high-fidelity design assets defined by So Company Design team
Create standard design document formats in UX prototyping tools, Adobe Creative Suite, and/or Google Drive
Assist in brainstorming/design exercises and project documentation
Assist in developing and maintain documentation of So Company Design System and Client Design Systems
Complete assigned tasks from photo editing, photo sourcing, or producing vector illustrations and graphics per project. Guidelines will be defined by So Company Design team.

Preferred Qualifications:

1-3 years of experience in user experience design
Solid knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and XD
Experience using UX prototyping tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, or Sketch
Passion about user experience, human-centered design, and following best-practice standards
A team-oriented mindset with great communication skills
Proven ability to learn new technology quickly and proficiently

Bonus qualities include:

Experience creating design systems and following/maintaining strict design system guidelines

Experience working remotely

Job Type: Full-time

Health Reimbursement Account (HRA)
401(k)

job_descriptions.e8151a4fb840c860:
Konrad Group

Konrad Group is a next generation digital consultancy. We are dedicated to solving complex business problems for our global clients with creative and forward-thinking solutions. Our employees enjoy a culture built on innovation and a commitment to creating best-in-class digital products in use by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. We hire exceptionally smart, analytical, and hard working people who are lifelong learners.

Experience Designer (UI/UX)

As an Experience Designer (UI/UX) you will be responsible for designing compelling digital experiences from conception to delivery in a cross-functional environment. You will bridge the gap between design, business, and technology to ship world-class digital experiences for leading companies and global brands.

Responsibilities

Develop a comprehensive understanding of project needs by attending design thinking workshops, performing user research, conducting user tests, and designing rich interactive experiences
Identify areas of opportunities for clients and solve functional challenges through brainstorming, ideating, and designing digital solutions with other members of the team
Work with developers and consultants to understand technology requirements and business objectives as they relate to the designs of the products
Build industry-leading solutions by staying up to date with design best practices and latest technologies
Contribute to Konrad's overall design culture by learning emerging softwares, standards and processes

Successful candidates will have

1-3 years experience in UI and UX design
Strong conceptual thinking and design execution abilities in both visual and interaction desig
Intimate knowledge of Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite and prototyping tools
Experience in motion design and web or mobile development is a bonus
Organization, interpersonal and communication skills, with a passion towards the digital space

Perks and Benefits

Flexible Vacation Policy
Health & Wellness Programs
Culture of Learning & Development
Fully-Stocked Kitchens & Lounges
New Shiny Device Upgrades
Monthly Socials & Team Outings

Bonus Points: Have you taken any courses at BrainStation? A lot of our design and development best practices and processes are taught during our courses - make sure to highlight this experience in your cover letter if you have!

Konrad Group is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

job_descriptions.49e4ea89f0874612:
The powerhouse team at Trusted Media Brands is actively seeking a talented and enthusiastic UX Designer to join our fast-growing team. As a UX Designer you’ll work with a collaborative team of Engineers and Product Managers to ideate and design best-in-class user experiences for our websites. You will play a critical role in translating business and strategic objectives into user flows and interfaces and will be responsible for creating wireframes, structural screen designs, and prototypes. Candidate must thrive in a fast-paced work environment and exhibit strong problem-solving skills and an aptitude for team collaboration and communication.

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Manage design initiatives on desktop, mobile and connected platforms, while contributing design direction to designers on other teams.
Collaborate with developers, product owners, marketing, and content managers to define innovative product experiences that result in improved user experience and productivity.
Gather and translate customer and business requirements into defined specifications.
Drive and document design standards and patterns across products.
Be an active participant and/or facilitator in product ideation, review and feedback discussions.
Conduct research with key stakeholders to review and validate approach and methodology (including, but not limited to interviews, usability and A/B tests).
Research and share industry trends, competitors, and comparable experiences.
Be the foremost company expert in user interface best practices and standards; be able to enforce them.
Be able to sell the benefits of TMB’s UX process/strategies to key stakeholders.


QUALIFICATIONS:

4-7 years of experience in user experience design and a portfolio of web-based UX work demonstrating a strategic approach and an understanding of responsive design and mobile interfaces
Experience working on highly trafficked content-driven websites and/or subscription services with a focus on conversion – experience across both a huge plus
Experience with concept creation, wireframing, sitemapping, and user flows w/ tap-able/clickable prototypes
Experience working with developers on multiple platforms and in a range of development methodologies
Expertise in use-case and business requirement gathering processes and experience in the application of contextual inquiry, interviews and other techniques
Able to balance business requirements with design aesthetic
Excellent presentation and communication skills and the ability to persuade others through objective review and analysis of concepts and ideas
Ability to manage multiple projects and an ability to prioritize and organize to meet tasks and deadlines; are also able to adjust to changing priorities
Possess a detail-oriented and strategic approach to work and strong time management and interpersonal skills in a fast-paced environment
Experience with the Adobe Creative Suite, Adobe XD, InVision, Sketch, Zeplin, Ceros
Experience with A/B testing practices
Experience with Sales-driven initiatives


ABOUT:

Trusted Media Brands, a media and direct marketing company, connects consumers through compelling content. We build uplifting communities and provide products and services that bring passions to life. Come join our team!


Trusted Media Brands is an equal opportunity employer committed to workforce diversity. job_descriptions.8d2e6da5dea72af5:
Note: Reflexions is working fully remotely for health and safety reasons for the immediate future. All interviews will occur via video conference. This position is available to US-based candidates regardless of their current residence within the US, but consideration will be given to candidates able to work during our EST/EDT business hours and those located within or willing and able to relocate to the Greater New York area.

Reflexions is seeking a thoughtful and energetic UI/UX designer to join our design team. You will support other members of the team as well as take the lead on new, ongoing, and supportive design tasks.


This position requires an ability to create, interpret, and iterate on different types of design documentation, including wireframes, step-by-step userflows, high-fidelity mockups, and prototyping demonstrating user interaction and animation. You will need to be energetically curious about expanding your skillset, emerging trends, platforms, and technologies.


This position requires a strong working knowledge of up-to-date best practices for web and interface design, including component-focused/pattern-based design, responsive and mobile-first principles, and designing for accessibility, and sophisticated web typography and layout.


You will be expected to collaborate closely with other design, development, QA, and customer-facing team members; you can expect a supportive, knowledgeable, and inclusive team to help you succeed.

Reflexions is an equal-opportunity employer, and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply.


You will:

Create UX design documentation communicating critical flows and interface variations to both internal team members and clients
Design the look, layout, and interactive features of websites, apps, and interactive interfaces
Participate in the design and upkeep of components and patterns within libraries
Iterate designs based on client and internal feedback
Participate in in-house design critiques of your own and others’ work and monthly check-ins
Participate as-needed in internal website testing, including constructively reporting UI/UX bugs to ensure high-quality launches
Meet with clients to present design work
Play different roles on different projects, and take on additional duties as appropriate
A good candidate must demonstrate:

1–3 years of professional experience working in a full-time capacity as a designer. This position is expected to be junior to mid-level.
An excellent portfolio of design work that must include both visual web design as well as meaningful UX documentation. We will be looking especially for completed work that has progressed through all stages of discovery, design, and development.
Creative and critical thinking, independence, initiative, and the ability to work with a team
The ability to work within or and thoughtfully extend existing brand or interactivity guidelines as well as the ability to participate in the design of new visual and interactive systems
Confidence in all phases of a project, from ideation through creation of production-ready design work
Proficiency with Sketch, especially symbols, styles, and library files
Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite
Experience working under deadline
Attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A great candidate will also be able to demonstrate some (though not necessarily all) of the following qualifications:

Experience preparing for, participating in, and/or responding to user/usability testing
Experience with animation, especially web-based, interface-focused animation
Experience designing to WCAG/ADA accessibility standards and an understanding of basic concepts related to designing for accessibility generally

Experience designing web-based, mobile, or screen-based interactive applications
Experience with front-end development tools and concepts, including the basics of web production and various tools of the trade (such as CSS3, JS, HTML5, layout frameworks, LESS/SASS, Git, etc.)
Experience communicating effectively with developers
A design degree or bootcamp certificate is not a requirement for consideration, but an outstanding portfolio is. We will work with you to develop skills and knowledge in areas you have less experience. Reflexions is looking for a great candidate who wants to push themselves and learn on the job.

In your cover letter, please:
include a link to your portfolio showing recent work, and
tell us about something you learned from a recent project, and how that new experience helps make you a great candidate,
tell us briefly about a skill you’d like to learn and in what way you think it would positively effect your working process.
Benefits

You can expect a supportive, knowledgeable, and inclusive team to help you succeed. Our benefits include:

Competitive salary, commensurate with experience
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life and disability coverages, FSA, HSA
Generous paid time off
Learning and development stipends
Commuter benefits
401(k) retirement plan
Because of COVID-19, Reflexions is currently 100% work-from-home. If you are accepted for this position, we will supply you with necessary computer hardware/software.
job_descriptions.121d99443d0d28ce:
Hello, we're Stylitics!

Stylitics is the leading visual outfitting and styling solution for the world's top retailers and brands. Founded in 2011, Stylitics uses a powerful combination of algorithms, trend data, and stylist expertise to deliver thousands of on-brand outfit recommendations daily across multiple channels such as e-commerce, email, advertising, stores, and social media which increase sales and customer retention.

About the role:

We are looking for a collaborative and accomplished Lead UI/UX Designer to design the next generation of retail experiences across the sites, apps, and marketing channels of our clients. Join us on our Product team! Stylitics has the awesome responsibility of helping the best retailers and brands in the world roll out digital experiences that use outfits, bundles, and gift sets to assist and inspire the shopper. Your role will be to upgrade the UI/UX of our current e-commerce experiences, used by tens of millions of shoppers each month and to design new digital experiences that retailers and shoppers will love.

You're the great fit for us, if...

As our Lead Designer, you are a passionate, creative, out-of-the-box problem solver with a commitment to doing high-quality work. You come with a solid track record for designing customer-facing products (ideally, mobile-first) that excite your clients and customers. You use data and customer feedback to guide your creative decision-making. You design with your customer in mind, prioritizing usability first. You independently work on keeping abreast of industry trends, best practices, and technologies. You are able to run and project-manage a fast-paced, productive design and feedback process with a variety of stakeholders. You are extremely good at what you do, but welcome feedback and work with minimal ego to get to the best outcome.

At the end of the day, you raise the bar of all UI/UX design projects, help us continually improve our processes, and can grow with the company as we scale rapidly.

What you will do:

Create workflows, wireframes, and develop visual mock-ups and interactive prototypes with a mobile-first perspective.
Ability to effectively document and hand-off design files to developers and engineers.
Collaborate with product management and development leaders to define and implement innovative interaction and interface solutions.
Ability to clearly define the problem, articulate use cases, upshift the design system and user flows.
Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design problems within the product.
Define KPI's and measurement strategy to leverage site analytics and continually improve the user and site experience.
Partner with a cross-functional team of product managers, business users, and engineers to define and prioritize features supporting business priorities and outcomes.
Work alongside the development team to understand product limitations and deliver solutions.
Perform usability testing and identify friction points in user-journeys and provide resolution options through A/B testing.

What we are looking for:

7+ years experience in UX/UI with at least 4 of those years in the retail/fashion industry.
BA/BS degree in human-centered design, user experience, design communication, or related field or work experience as a designer.
Great research skills, and ability to understand complex, abstract ideas.
Come to the table with examples of user experience projects or portfolio required.
Excellent communication skills to engage with users, engineers, product partners, and stakeholders at all levels.
Strong project planning, tracking & organizing skills.
Being confident to take the initiative along with impeccable follow-up skills.
Must be a self-motivated, well-organized individual who pays close attention to detail and is able to effectively prioritize in a fast-paced, fast-changing environment.
Strong oral, written, and presentation skills.
Being able to work towards goals on an individual and team level.
Someone who sees themself working day to day in an environment and culture driven by our values.

Our values

Our values reflect what is important to us at Stylitics and serve as the foundation in which we do business. Each core value is best illustrated by actions and attitudes that each Stylitics team members practices. They define what working at Stylitics means and what our teams embody in through their time here.

We care deeply about delivering high quality work.
We work to be the best partners possible.
We get things done.
We believe the right team matters most.
We think like customers and act like owners.
We relish being pioneers.

What we offer (benefits/perks):

A company that recognizes that our people are our greatest asset - if you're investing in us, we are investing in you. Trust us, this mindset and philosophy goes a long way in your (and our) experience.
Competitive salary along with career planning for the future.
Health insurance - medical, dental and vision plan options with Aetna.
Commuter Benefits (for when we are commuting again!)
401k Plan with Slavik.
An amazing team to work with!
A culture that promotes transparency and engagement as the company grows.

EEO Statement

Equal Employment Opportunity has been and will continue to be, a fundamental principle at Stylitics where employment is based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination because of race, religion, color, gender, national origin, age, citizenship, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, pregnancy and related medical conditions, veteran status, genetic information, disability or any other reason prohibited by federal, state or local law. This applies to all policies and employment practices relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment.
job_descriptions.3a777d44c2f45b7c:
Peloton is seeking a UX Designer to help define, in detail, "how" features on our engagement products (such as the Peloton web and mobile apps, the Peloton Bike, and the Peloton Tread) function, and how they are are interacted with by our users.

This role is focused on designing UX and information for new features (from an overall product strategy and roadmap) defined by the Product Manager. The UX designer must think in non-linear terms: capturing interactions, edge-cases, and the various states of these experiences through deliverables such as user flows, product maps, wireframes, storyboards, and prototypes. They should be comfortable with an agile approach to design, with an emphasis on user testing and rapid iteration.

The UX designer also seeks to understand Peloton user behavior and motivation at a fundamental level, by working with UX Researchers to develop test plans and through the development of journey maps, user personas, and other artifacts.

Outside exceptional and high-velocity UX thinking and execution, success in this role is dependent on being highly self-motivated, super organized, always open to feedback and critique, and extremely collaborative.

The UX Designer works directly with the Product Manager, Visual UI Designers, engineers, and technical project manager on one of several Peloton Engagement teams and collaborates with the broader Product, UX, and Design team to deliver a consistent Peloton experience across all platforms.

Note: This is not a UI design role. At Peloton, the UI Designer is a separate role responsible for executing the final "pixel perfect" designs and "look and feel" of our interfaces.

Note: Along with your Resume a link to your online portfolio (or to a PDF of your work) is required. Applications without a portfolio are unlikely to be considered.

IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL:

Cultivate a deep understanding of Peloton's existing product UX across platforms and ensure any future iterations are executed with reverence for a cohesive experience.
Work closely and collaboratively with the Visual UI designer and Product Manager on your team to fulfill the overall product/feature vision.
Manage your bandwidth and project pipeline to execute UX design in time with your team's software roadmap.

Collaboratively brainstorm and evolve feature UX with the Product Manager and wider scrum team.

Create extremely detailed user flows, product maps, wireframes, etc. based on requirements from Product Management, and communicate UX clearly to relevant teams.
Build out multi-version comps for user testing.

Prototype user experiences and work with UX Researchers to develop user tests.

Quickly iterate and offer versions based on design critique from peers or from learnings found in user testing or feature response.

Capture all states, edge-cases, "unhappy paths" and path logic for visual UI design and engineering teams to build out.

Evaluate, test, and iterate on current core experiences.

Work with Product Management, Engineering, and Visual UI Design to ensure executed work matches UX vision.


ABOUT YOU:

2+ Years of Software User Experience and/or Information Architecture experience at consumer-focused technology company.
Top tier User Experience, Testing, Research and Information Architecture skills.
Focused and dedicated to how software products "function" and how users move through the experience to accomplish their goals.
Strong, proven skill in creating wireframes and other common UX design artifacts. And a deeply collaborative and iterative approach to product UX,, focused on ensuring a unified experience across products.
Obsessive attention to detail and ability to conceptualize multi-state, multi-path interaction systems and to consistently capture edge-cases.
Exceptional design velocity: especially in developing wireframe and flow variations. And an ability and willingness to quickly produce multiple concepts.
Excellent communication and organization skills. And can produce clear and descriptive documentation for implementation targeted to a variety of roles and personality types: Experience working closely with engineers, product managers, and visual UI designers.
Understands interaction design fundamentals and UI design best practices (for collaboration with the UI designer.) Understands what is possible in modern Android, iOS, and web development and of design and interaction patterns and trends within each.
Has experience conducting and coordinating remote- and in-person user research using a variety of methodologies, and in documenting the results and findings.
Has experience using prototyping and user testing practices to understand usability of concepts and to learn and iterate on the UX design.
Familiarity with agile software development and lean UX processes. Bonus if you have experience design UX for native consumer-facing apps, interactive game or content experiences, or large touch screens and/or TV interfaces.
Exists on the cutting edge of UX design – and pushes our user research, testing, and design infrastructure and practices.

ABOUT PELOTON

Peloton is the largest interactive fitness platform in the world with a loyal community of more than 2.6 million Members. The company pioneered connected, technology-enabled fitness, and the streaming of immersive, instructor-led boutique classes for its Members anytime, anywhere. Peloton makes fitness entertaining, approachable, effective, and convenient, while fostering social connections that encourage its Members to be the best versions of themselves. An innovator at the nexus of fitness, technology, and media, Peloton has reinvented the fitness industry by developing a first-of-its-kind subscription platform that seamlessly combines the best equipment, proprietary networked software, and world-class streaming digital fitness and wellness content, creating a product that its Members love. The brand's immersive content is accessible through the Peloton Bike, Peloton Tread, and Peloton App, which allows access to a full slate of fitness classes across disciplines, on any iOS or Android device, Fire TV, Roku, Chromecast and Android TV. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in New York City, Peloton has a growing number of retail showrooms across the US, UK, Canada and Germany. For more information, visit www.onepeloton.com.

job_descriptions.6391046e92411fec:
About Terakeet
Terakeet is an enterprise search engine optimization company that leverages 20+ years of expertise and our best-in-class proprietary technology to earn significant organic search engine visibility and brand reputation protection for Fortune 500 companies and other global brands.
Summary

Terakeet is looking for an experienced and passionate User Experience Designer to join our growing product team. In this role, you will work collaboratively and build iteratively with a multidisciplinary team of developers, product managers, account managers and designers. We believe in testing, iteration and in giving people the room to experiment and grow.

You should be comfortable with an agile approach to design, working on a mix of new and existing internal products, as well as customer websites. The candidate must have the dual ability to be a strategic thinker and be hands-on in an evolving, product design environment.

Essential Functions

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the following essential functions:

Develops product concepts, roadmaps, test plans and functional specifications documentation
Creates artifacts such as user stories, wireframes, and prototypes to effectively convey product workflow architecture and user experiences
Collaborates with multidisciplinary teams to conceptualize and design product roadmap
Gathers necessary requirements to create an accurate scope and project plan for multiple tracks of work
Effectively communicates UX deliverables and research findings to team members
Supports the product team during research and discovery but also leads ideation phases to translate concepts into specific product features and design ideas
Performs qualitative and quantitative user testing throughout the design process
Works with the product team to ensure projects have clear goals and success metrics
Collaborates with fellow UX team members to define and shape the UX role and process

The above description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Preferred Education, Experience, and Skills
4-7 years of experience as a UX Designer working on internal products and tools, B2C products, and conducting user research

Proven track record in working collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams to drive results, and can interact effectively with representatives from teams such as Product, Sales, Technology, and Marketing

Ability to quickly translate and communicate complex problems or concepts visually
Strong proficiency in developing wireframes, site maps, and technical specifications

Prototyping experience in one or more tools such as Sketch, Proto.io, Drama.app, Figma

Demonstrates thoroughness, follow-up, attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines

Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize, multi-task and work under shifting deadlines

Experience creating and running qualitative and quantitative UX research studies

Exceptional communication, analytical, and interpersonal skills
BS or BA degree in fields such as HCI, Industrial Design, Product Design, Graphic Design, Information science or Psychology

EEO Statement

Terakeet provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

job_descriptions.0ba94a8ae759ac8d:
LivePerson is a transformational force in how Brands and Consumers communicate. With over 18,000 customers including HSBC, Disney, Verizon, and Home Depot, we are on a mission to make life easier for people and brands everywhere through trusted conversational AI. We believe in a future where conversations are the norm for getting your intentions fulfilled - whatever they are.

We are an innovative, intent-driven company that believes in building the future and we are looking for growth minded, unconventional thinkers to join the team.

You will thrive here if:

You can operate in a fast paced, dynamic environment

You nerd out about AI, how it can be applied, or how you can learn more about it (don't worry we'll help)

You believe data-led decision making is the norm

You see feedback or failure as motivation to learn and to grow

You relate to our core principles and want to work with experts in their respective fields

In this role you will:

Design effective, innovative, and delightful conversational experiences using user-centric design methodologies
Work with major enterprise brands to understand their business goals, their customer personas and intents to define an automation roadmap
Research and analyze intents and the associated customer journeys. Evaluate when bots are appropriate and in what form
Create bot design documents, including bot personas, example dialogs, conversation flow diagrams, error handling patterns
Define the intent portfolio for natural language understanding and how it maps in to conversation designs
Review customer transcripts to identify gaps in the conversation design; modify design patterns to bridge those gaps
Write copy suitable for automated conversations in the messaging medium
Interpret bot performance metrics to hypothesize where design changes can be made and tested to drive specific goals
Review and give feedback on designs from peers, including mentoring colleagues who may or may not be designers
Create and evangelize conversation design best practice standards, reusable design patterns and processes
Collaborate with LivePerson project managers, optimization managers, bot developers, and bot tuners to execute on bot implementation
Demonstrate effective verbal and written communication to internal executives, C-level clients, partners, and team members
Recommend resource allocation and identify all delivery needs and resources in line with customer requirements and desired outcomes

Preferred skills and experience:

Significant experience in bot strategy, conversation design and optimization and can produce a portfolio of example work.
We consider diverse backgrounds - you may be a UX designer with a knack for language, or a Communications/Linguistics major with a knack for design thinking, or a game designer with experience on dialogue systems, etc.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, having presented design thought leadership to diverse audiences, from client executives to technical team members
Knowledge of Natural Language Understanding technologies and platforms such as Dialogflow, Watson, LUIS, etc. and how it impacts conversation designs
Knowledge of messaging channels such as web messaging, SMS, Whatsapp, etc. and what the advantages and disadvantages are of each
Contact center and/or customer service experience a plus
Bachelor's Degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience

Why you'll love working here:

LivePerson was named to FastCompany's World's most innovative companies of 2020 list for the Artificial Intelligence category. We offer amazing colleagues along with opportunities to push your own limits to grow. We embrace invention and experimentation. You'll have great benefits plus flexible time off and free lunch on fridays. Most importantly, you'll have an ability to make an impact at work and at brands across the globe as we build the future with trusted Conversational AI together.

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to do their best work and be their authentic selves. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Job Description:
This career defining, long-term, one year freelance role (with opportunity to extend) at our Fortune 100 globally recognized brands, as mid-level UX Product Designer, 100% remote right now but must be NY based, 40 hours a week, healthcare benefits provided, 401K, 5 paid sick days.
Our client shares, they take our people’s well-being and enjoyment at work seriously which is why they put a strong effort on creating a creative safe space for people to share work and ask questions that will help you grow individually.
What You Will Do:
Our client is looking for a (mid-level) UX Product Designer to help enhance the client experience which will enable them to improve customer’s UX experience with a new 3-D Design platform.
Working closely with the Lead UX Designer, you will help execute the product vision by being involved in every step of the end-to-end product design process
Craft intuitive and elegant experiences that empower our clients to make confident financial decisions
Work closely with our research team to synthesize qualitative and quantitative data and make value-driven design decisions that translate into clear, simple UIs
Create and present a variety of design deliverables (sketches, wireframes, user flows and prototypes) in a way that engenders confidence in you and your solutions with the team
Design and deliver responsive/adaptive solutions that are optimized for web and mobile interfaces and partner with engineers to translate designs into successful products
Work closely with the larger Wealth Management UX Team to share design best practices, align on patterns, and promote a design-centric culture at the firm

Portfolio that demonstrates how you have created experiences that solved business and user needs
4+ years as a UX Designer on an in-house creative team
Bachelor's degree in design or related field (Master’s degree a plus)

You thrive in a collaborative, explorative environment and value being on a diverse team that you can bounce ideas off of, get critical feedback from and unite with to mature design thinking within a large organization
You practice active listening and contribute in group situations (i.e. brainstorms, audits, whiteboard sessions, etc.) and get excited by complex projects are resilient in the face of obstacles
You have a relentless desire to validate assumptions and uncover a problem’s root cause by testing, learning and iterating, have a knack for balancing user goals, technology needs and business objectives and are able to clearly explain rationale for your designs

What is it like working with Aquent? I’m glad you asked! Freelancing long-term with Aquent gets you access to some pretty cool things including:

That’s it! The rest is up to you, if you are interested in this amazing opportunity please send your resume to: jward@aquent.com

job_descriptions.2ddff5a72623f15c:
COVID Update - We are actively hiring for this position and have been operating as a fully distributed organization across the United States since FireHydrant started. We anticipate a future where we will be able to periodically gather as a company again, but we put the health and wellbeing of our employees (and their families) first.

About FireHydrant

FireHydrant helps companies recover from IT disasters more quickly. The FireHydrant platform includes Incident Response, Status Pages, Retrospectives, and Deploy Events so you can take control of your complex system, reduce downtime, and work better together. We're a Series A company with around 20 employees who sit across the United States and we're growing.

About The Role

FireHydrant is seeking a UI Designer to create simple, elegant, and intuitive interactive interfaces for our function-heavy products. This role is focused on visual interactive interface design: how users interact with devices, how users process information, and ultimately how FireHydrant's products "look" and "feel". Core to this role is the creation of the final "pixel-perfect" UI that FireHydrant customers experience, and in creating UI in a visually systematic way that ensures a holistic, consistent experience across our products.

Outside exceptional UI and interaction design talent, success in this role is dependent on being highly self-motivated and managed, super organized, always open to feedback and critique, and extremely collaborative. The UI Designer works directly with the Head of Product (Dylan), UX Designer (Jen), and engineers on the core FireHydrant product team.

What You'll Do

Create and maintain design systems and component libraries in conjunction with the wider Product Design team to ensure product-wide visual consistency.
Provide interactive prototypes/deliverables to describe interactions and motion to enhance UI.
Iterate based on design critique from peers or from learnings found in user testing.
Build out multi-version comps for user testing.
Execute final, "pixel perfect" UI designs and package, spec, and prep for engineering.
Continuously audit developed software for visual perfection (always be QA'ing!), and provide detailed feedback to engineering towards revisions.

What You'll Bring

Passion for design work and technology, you love what you do.
Top tier user interface and interaction design skills.
Deeply collaborative and iterative approach to product design, focused on ensuring a unified experience across the board.
Fierce attention to detail, understanding of accessibility guidelines and focus on 'look' and 'feel' for a variety of screen sizes.
Understanding of prototyping UI interactivity and incorporating motion/animation into UI.
Experience working closely with engineers to develop and iterate on interactive software experiences.
Previous software UI/interaction design experiences at business-focused tech companies.
Exceptional design velocity: ability and willingness to quickly produce multiple concepts.
A strong understanding of the tools and technologies involved in designing and building interactive software experiences including Sketch and InVision.
A keen knowledge of design and interaction patterns and trends within each.

We'd Like to See You Accomplish

Improve and mature the apps experience by creating a modern look and feel.
Standardize and create cohesion across UI components.
Unify the product, brand and marketing design.
Increase design and engineering efficiencies from building out a company wide design system.

Life at FireHydrant

We're remote-first with engineers around the US, our headquarters is in NYC (Union Square)
We collaborate through Slack, Zoom, GitHub pull requests, Notion, and Clubhouse
We believe in a healthy work-life balance; we're early stage but work reasonable hours and want you to use your vacation time

Benefits

100% employer-paid health, vision and dental premiums for the employee and 75% of dependents
Unlimited vacation policy with a minimum requirement of three weeks off per-year
Wellness program: reimbursements for your gym membership, athletic equipment, nutrition plans, etc
Education budget: conferences, books, online courses, etc
A stipend to outfit your home office beyond the laptop/monitor
401k match

Note: Along with your Resume a link to your online portfolio (or to a PDF of your work) is required. Applications without a portfolio are unlikely to be considered.
