Great News! The Nation’s Top Physical Therapy Practice (that’s us!) is looking for lifetime members to join our unconventionally passionate family.

About the Company:
SPEAR Physical Therapy is the APTA's- private practice section- National Practice of the Year! SPEAR Physical Therapy is one of the fastest-growing and most progressive physical therapy company in New York City. We consistently receive 5-star Yelp! reviews for our customer service, due in large part to our core team of talented and dedicated staff members. Our company values (or our SPEAR-IT Standards) are Service, Passion, Empathy, Accountability, Respect, Integrity, and Teamwork. The people we take on board live and breathe our values every day, which helps SPEAR impact the lives of over 150,000 New Yorkers a year. We have recently been named the “Nations Top Physical Therapy Company” by the Private Practice Section of the American Physical Therapy Association. This award has never been won by another New York company and is awarded to less than .01% of all physical therapy companies in the nation. SPEAR has also been awarded the “Leadership Development Award” by the New York Physical Therapy Association for a company that exemplifies the spirit, creation and implementation of leadership development. Also, SPEAR was selected to ring the bell at the New York Stock Exchange during National Small Business week.
SPEAR is also the only NYC-based privately-owned physical therapy practice accredited by New York State Department of Education to provide CEU credits to its therapists for its own proprietary on-site management and clinical training meetings (which is the fastest and most effective way to fulfill your CEU obligations). And, its costs are fully covered by SPEAR!
Talent Acquisition Specialist

Our Shared Values - As a SPEAR team member, you naturally exhibit SPEAR’s values by default. Your talents instinctively result in actions of Service, Passion, Empathy, Accountability, Respect, Impact and Teamwork. You put people first, and know that each teammate, and each New Yorker, can rely on you to help them become the best versions of themselves.

Your Impact - The Talent Acquisition Specialist is responsible for the complete recruitment cycle and meeting human capital demands of SPEAR as the organization continues to grow. As the primary point of contact for all candidates, hiring managers and external vendors, you will ensure that SPEAR can efficiently staff all open roles. You have the initiative to proactively solve problems before they arise and support decisions through data reporting. The Talent Acquisition Specialist is also responsible for supporting the HR Department with onboarding, new hire orientation, system maintenance, compliance, performance management and system related items on an as needed basis.

Organization Structure:
Reports to: Director, HR
Primary interactions: All SPEAR Employees (Including Directors) and Candidates

SPEAR-IT Values:Respect & Teamwork: You approach every interaction from a place of respect and teamwork. You are committed to serving as a resource for directors and candidates. You work closely with managers and candidates so that they understand the recruitment process and the systems available to them.
Impact & Passion: You are a champion of SPEAR’s Human Resources Information System - Ceridian Dayforce and you provide reports to show the impact of Recruitment and Onboarding on the organization.Empathy & Service: You provide 5-star customer service to all SPEAR employees. You respond efficiently and accordingly because you understand their feelings and needs.Accountability: You take pride in meeting all recruitment deadlines and understand the impact this has on the candidate and Hiring Managers’ experience.

Success Factors:
Recruitment:
o Respond to all inquiries and requests within 8 businesses hours.
o Posts jobs externally within 24 hours of receiving notice of opening from Hiring Manager
o Connects viable candidates with Directors within 24 hours of screening
o Train all new managers on recruitment procedures and systems within 1 week of start
o Ensures strong vendor relationships with Hireright, Ceridian, Indeed, Linked In, Medbridge etc. so that any system or other issues are addressed within 24 hours.
o Fosters new relationships and maintains existing relationships with career services staff at universities with DPT programs.
Onboarding:
o Issue offer letter & initiate background screening within 24 hours of a hiring decision
o Send new hires & directors Employee’s onboarding resources at least 2 business days before start date
o Assign all new hires MedBridge Compliance learning track and other role specific training 2 business days prior to employee’s start date
o Run monthly reporting to track completion of compliance training
HR Systems
o Responds to all HR systems issues within 2 hours of reporting inclusive of
Ceridian Talent modules (Recruitment, Onboarding and Performance Management) Hireright, Medbridge, SPEAR Intranet, Indeed, Linked In,
o Complete system updates to align with department or company initiatives

Position Summary:
Recruitment
o Monitors applications for open roles daily, identifies candidates for first round interviews
o Completes detailed documentation of a candidate’s progression through the interview process within 24 hours of an interview
o Maintains average time to fill of 30 days for all roles
o Complies and distributes weekly & monthly recruitment reports.
o Ensures strong SPEAR presence at campus career fairs by working with hiring managers to solicit participation, coordinate logistics and communicate details
o Monitors and maintains Ceridian Dayforce for the Recruitment module
o Support the planning and execution of the Classroom to Clinician event twice annually
Onboarding
o Measure Onboarding & Off boarding activities for all teams to ensure they are completed prior to New Hire start date and by Employee’s last day; disable SPEAR Intranet and Compliance training accounts
o Troubleshoots any onboarding issues and answers questions from new hires regarding offer letter, systems, and onboarding resources
o Communicates onboarding changes to all departments involved in the process
o Maintains and updates onboarding forms
HR Systems
o Responds to all system inquiries within 4 hours; schedule training for employees within 5 business days of request
o Assigns employees to Mid-Year and Annual Reviews cycles and monitor completion of reviews; offer support as needed
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position.
SPEAR Physical Therapy is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job_descriptions.6c2492f569cc06a7:
Hello, World! Codecademy has helped over 45 million people from around the world upgrade their careers with engaging, accessible, and flexible education on programming and data skills. We provide over 200 hands-on interactive lessons ranging from Python to R to Javascript and everything in between. Our learners have gone on to start companies, new jobs, and new lives thanks to what they've learned with Codecademy, and we're thrilled to be working to take that impact to the next level.

Codecademy was started in 2011 by two college students in a dorm room at Columbia that were frustrated by the huge gap between education and employment. A few years later, we are a rapidly growing, diverse team of 75+ in SoHo, NYC. We've raised over $40m in venture capital funding from top investors including Union Square Ventures, Kleiner Perkins, Naspers, Y Combinator, and more.

If you want to help build a business that impacts tens of millions of people each year and helps them lead better lives, join us!

Codecademy's talent team is a collaborative, supportive, high performing, and lean team dedicated to sourcing, recruiting, and selling the best candidates to help us build the tools to teach millions of people how to upgrade their careers. We are looking for a driven Business Recruiter with a demonstrated history of success working on sales, marketing, finance, and/or HR roles at technology focused companies.

What You'll Do
Partner with Codecademy Talent Team to define and accomplish hiring goals
Manage full-cycle recruiting process for a variety of Business roles (Finance, Marketing, Sales, and other roles as needed); from sourcing candidates to coordinating interviews to offer delivery
Work closely with Hiring Managers across the organization to develop a deep understanding of team functions and needs
Continuously find opportunities to relentlessly improve and fine tune process to deliver best-in-class candidate experience
Work with the Talent Team to develop innovative recruiting and sourcing strategies that realize diversity, inclusion, and talent for Codecademy
Work on cross-functional project work and participate in recruiting events as needed
What You'll Need
3+ years of agency and/or internal technical recruiting experience
Proven track record of identifying and assessing top talent
Sourcing experience using a variety of tools-LinkedIn Recruiter is a plus
Experience using application tracking systems-Greenhouse is a plus
A commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion
A meticulous approach to organization
An innate understanding of how to prioritize
Excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills to effectively communicate the Codecademy mission to candidates
What Will Make You Stand Out
Sales, Marketing, Finance, and HR recruiting experience both in house and with some agency roots
Startup or SaaS recruiting experience
Network of sales, marketing, finance, and HR employees in NYC area
Data analytical experience to derive insights from recruiting data
At Codecademy, an interest in learning to code is strongly preferred
At Codecademy, we are committed to teaching people the skills they need to upgrade their careers. Codecademy aims to educate a richly diverse demographic of users with our product and in order to accomplish this, we believe our team should reflect that rich diversity. Our company celebrates diversity in all of its forms- race, gender, color, national origin, marital status, sexuality, religion, veteran status, age, ability, disability status- and works to create an inclusive workplace where people of all backgrounds and beliefs are empowered to better their futures.

job_descriptions.c292f5e5e4539082:
Discovery hires the very best and brightest talent who are enthusiastic and passionate to fulfill the company’s mission of empowering people to explore their world and satisfy their curiosity.
In exchange for their talent and drive, employees are provided with an engaging, diverse workplace and the resources they need to learn, thrive and grow in their careers.
Watch Our Reel Here
The Company
Operating in one of the most interesting, innovative and fluid industries, a role within Discovery’s Product and Tech organization offers a fantastic career opportunity.

Discovery's Direct-to-Consumer business operates a group of both well established brands and well-funded start-ups. We operate teams working at the crossroads of tech and entertainment. We are fast, nimble and have fun developing new, innovative and immersive digital content for iconic brands, including Discovery Channel, Eurosport, Dplay, Food Network, MotorTrend Group, as well as newer brands such as GolfTV.

As content creators in the digital space, we’re building on the Discovery legacy by using technology to evolve the viewing experience… telling better, more immersive stories to millions of viewers across the Internet every day.

Our Team
It takes an army of incredibly talented, passionate and creative individuals to make this amazing content and the tech that distributes it and that’s where we come in! Discovery’s Talent team recruits the best talent the industry has to offer. We pride ourselves on hiring recruiters who are absolute experts at what they do. Passionate, with a keen eye for talent, well networked and up to date on industry innovations. If this sounds like you, keep reading.
The Opportunity
As Campus Recruiter for Discovery’s Direct to Consumer business, you’ll have one of the most exciting and impactful recruitment roles in the industry, building the Discovery Direct-to-Consumer Campus Recruiting footprint. Day to day you’ll be working with top universities and colleges to position Discovery as a first-choice employer for emerging talent among both undergraduate and post-graduate alumni. You’ll serve as brand ambassador and hands on recruiter in attracting the best and brightest upcoming Tech, Product, UX/UI and data talent. In addition, you’ll partner internally with the Sr. Director of Talent, HR and Business Leaders to design and create a competitive top tier onboarding and development program for our intern and graduate community.

This role can be based in New York or Bellevue, Washington.
Responsibilities
1. Responsible for the execution of full life-cycle campus recruiting for Discovery Inc
2. Serve as the primary point of contact for candidates, educational institutions and the internal business
3. Work closely with internal stakeholders to establish and/or design a tailored recruiting approach at designated school(s) to achieve demand
4. Leverage recruiting knowledge, recruitment results and competitive market intelligence to drive strategies and influence key internal stakeholders on recruitment activities and programs
5. Serve as a “Brand Ambassador” to expand our internal & external footprint to build the Discovery brand
6. Role may provide opportunity to manage established projects or conferences or develop new programs
Requirements
We're looking for someone to join the team who is passionate, proactive, delivery orientated, creative and able to think and learn quickly. This is an ever-evolving space and the ability to be agile and pivot at short notice is critical.
3+ years of university recruiting experience.
Knowledge of working with and navigating top engineering, product, design and data universities preferable.
Pre-existing relationships in this space would be an advantage.
Engineering, technology, product, UX/UI and/or data recruitment experience desirable.
Experience of engaging and building programs for this population
Ability to think creatively around building a campus strategy, create a big picture vision as well as execute the details
 Excellent communicator and collaborator, with the ability to build relationships and manage stakeholder expectations across all levels of the company
Strong ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced and dynamic environment
Understanding of how to build effective relationships with university officials and campus groups
Detail-oriented and highly organized, experience working on projects with multiple stakeholders
BA/BS degree
Must have the legal right to work in the United States
Discovery Communications, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Discovery is committed to being an employer of choice, not just a good place to work, but a great and inclusive place to work. To that end, we strive to recruit and maintain a workforce that meaningfully represents the diverse and culturally rich communities that we serve. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disabled status or, genetic information.
We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including but not limited to all local Fair Chance Ordinances.
EEO is the Law
Pay Transparency Policy Statement
California Job Applicant Privacy Policy
If you are an individual with a disability and need an accommodation during the application process, please send an email request to HR@discovery.com.

job_descriptions.6ed65894b52ce837:
Dandelion Energy is growing exponentially! We are looking for an experienced recruiter to help us meet our ambitious hiring goals and promote our mission of reducing carbon emissions from home heating and cooling. You'll manage the full recruiting life-cycle across a variety of business areas through strategic partnerships with hiring managers and providing best-in-class candidate experiences. This role reports to the Direct of Talent Acquisition and has the unique opportunity to make a huge impact on our growing organization

Let's face it- we have the best job in the company- we get to play a critical role in defining a company's success, and partnering with stakeholders as they navigate the exciting world of hiring employees in a fast-growth, mission-oriented start-up!

And to make things a bit more exciting you'll get a chance to work on a variety of initiatives to enhance our processes, employer brand, D&I and candidate experience.


What You'll Be Doing

Manage the full recruiting life-cycle, focusing on roles across our Operations Department.
Build strong relationships with candidates, and work to continually improve our candidate experience;
Partner closely with hiring managers on creative sourcing strategies and optimize our screening processes;
Act as a brand ambassador, promoting Dandelion's culture, mission and value proposition;
Develop your knowledge-base on Dandelion's business, culture, and market, and stay up to date on the recruiting industry's best practices and latest trends, sharing with the team;
Ensure the data integrity of our ATS (Greenhouse);
Collaborate with the recruiting team, HR and other partners on process improvements, events, D&I, employer branding and various other initiatives.

Who you are?

2-3 years of recruiting experience in-house at high-growth company. Experience recruiting field/construction roles or campus recruiting is a plus
You are independently driven, with a positive attitude and a sense of pride and ownership in your work;
You strive in a team environment and you are a great collaborator, willing to lend a helping hand and not afraid to ask for help when needed;
Building trust and rapport with candidates and managers comes naturally for you regardless of those individuals' backgrounds;
You are detail-oriented, and hold yourself accountable whether you're negotiating comp, keeping up on your candidate responses, or updating the ATS;
Let's face it, most people don't know what is Geothermal Energy, so having a passion for learning, from best practices to market intel to new creative sourcing strategies just comes with the territory
You have a Bachelor's degree or equivalent


Benefits/Perks

Health/Dental/Vision insurance offered from day 1!
401k plan offered
Stock/Equity options offered
Paid Sick and Vacation
Training support including on-the-job and virtual/online-based courses
Remote Work from the TriState area


You'll love working at Dandelion because:

We're solving the world's hardest problems. You'll have the opportunity to pioneer renewable heating and cooling from the ground-up (literally). There's no established playbook for fighting climate change, so your work will be messy, challenging, and build a better, cleaner world.

We're good people. It sounds simple, and it is. We are passionate, vision-driven, low-ego, and treat one another with kindness and respect. We challenge ideas here, not people.

We hold each other accountable. We celebrate our wins and learn from our losses. We're honest, realistic, and transparent across all areas of the business, every day - not just at our monthly all-hands meeting.

***************************************

Home geothermal technology was developed over half a century ago but has failed to reach widespread adoption despite being, on average, 48% more efficient than furnaces using gas, and 75% more efficient than furnaces using oil. While many HVAC companies sell geothermal heat pumps, they may only install a handful of custom systems each year, leaving them with little opportunity to develop or refine the specialized skill set required to enable peak system performance, let alone identify and manage inefficiencies at scale.

That's where Dandelion Geothermal comes in. Dandelion, formerly incubated at Google's X Lab, is on a mission to make geothermal heating and cooling affordable for homeowners by creating a totally streamlined process from start to finish. Dandelion now operates out of New York City and Upstate New York. We raised $23MM from leading investors including GV (formerly Google Ventures), and Comcast Ventures, with participation from Lennar Corporation (NYSE: LEN and LENB), as well as prior investors NEA, Collaborative Fund, and Ground Up.

job_descriptions.f8919d850cca89f4:
A great Recruiter stands apart by excelling at talent identification, attraction and assessment, and by developing deep partnerships with the business and within HR. An extraordinary recruiter stands out by doing all of the above combined with strong business savvy, a passion for their craft, and a genuine commitment for providing an unforgettable candidate experience.
You’ll thrive at Tesla by striking the right balance between flexibility and efficiency, project management and influencing. One hire at a time, we are finding the talent responsible for changing the world of energy and transportation and moving us forward to a more sustainable future. When you’re doing something nobody has ever done before, the old ways can frequently come up short. At Tesla, you’ll get the opportunity to be creative, to try, to fail, to learn and to succeed. You will have an appetite for risk, for taking that big bet, because that’s how we leap ahead together.

Responsibilities
Partnering with business leaders and hiring managers to assess their talent requirements and advising on the best hiring strategy
Shepherding the time and resources at your disposal effectively and keeping your business partners up to speed on a regular basis
Using a variety of techniques and creativity to discover and attract the best passive talent
Conducting thorough behavioral based interviews and phone screens to assess both technical baseline as well as skills be successful in the Tesla environment
Focusing on providing a great candidate experience at every opportunity

Requirements
BS/BA or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
High volume recruiting experience with the ability to efficiently manage an average of 50+ requisitions
Minimum of 3 years recruiting experience, preferably from both a corporate and/or agency environment
Demonstrated track record of excellence in sourcing and assessing technical talent
Proven relationship management experience with hiring teams and business partners, helping them navigate the sources of talent and assisting them with assessment
A genuine interest in technology as shown by continuous learning throughout your career
Skilled in offer negotiation, awareness of pertinent employment legislation and employment market trends
The ability to lead projects to successful conclusion – balancing efficiency with quality
Computer savvy – ATS experience and Microsoft Office (Avature preferred)

Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program

job_descriptions.8d899d0edf4cba96:
CLEAR's mission is to strengthen security and create frictionless experiences. We believe you are you and by using your biometrics – your eyes, face, and fingerprints – we keep you moving. Imagine a world where you can do virtually everything you need to – breeze through the airport, buy a beer at the game, check-in at the doctor's office, access your office building, and more – without ever pulling out your wallet. CLEAR is currently available in 50+ airports, stadiums and venues nationwide. Now with Health Pass, CLEAR securely connects a person's digital identity to multiple layers of COVID-related insights to help reduce public health risk and restore peace of mind.

We're defining and leading an entirely new industry, obsessing over our customers, and investing in great people to lead the way. Recently named on CNBC's Disruptor 50 List for the second year in a row and winner of the SXSW Interactive Innovation Award, CLEAR is providing innovative technology options for businesses and our 5+ million members to help create a safer environment no matter where you go.

We're looking for a driven Senior Corporate Recruiter to support CLEAR's continued growth. This role reports into our Head of Talent Acquisition and will partner with a range of functions across the business to deliver a best in class candidate experience alongside organizational results.
What You Will Do:

Work directly with recruiting and business leaders to deeply understand the requirements for all hires and their holistic impact on the company and product
Outline and execute on a creative approach to full lifecycle candidate engagement
Utilize talent market expertise, data, and business acumen to educate and influence hiring managers on how to identify their top talent.
Embed in business teams, building meaningful and trusted relationships with key stakeholders
Share best practices to continually iterate and raise the bar on candidate experience
Who You Are:

You have 5+ years of successful recruiting experience in a high-volume, rapidly scaling environment
You are metrics-minded and live in recruiting data
You're a relationship builder and look to engage with hiring managers and candidates proactively
Combined agency and in-house recruiting experience a plus
You're familiar with Greenhouse or a similar Applicant Tracking System

As the OD Talent Acquisition Partner on the MyEyeDr. Talent Acquisition team, you’ll play a critical role in the recruitment and hiring of Optometrist (OD) talent to fill our vacancies within our expanding network of offices. You’ll build talent pipelines of for future needs and leverage data and insights to partner with and advise Professional Services Hiring Managers.
This experienced recruiter will be a brand ambassador, providing an exceptional client experience and candidate experience. Reporting to the Director, Talent Acquisition, you’ll partner with a team of Talent Acquisition Partners and Operational and Professional Service Leaders to identify needs and deliver the highest quality OD talent available. To be successful in this role, the OD Talent Acquisition Partner must build great relationships, a strong multi-tasker, and have the ability to work effectively with minimal supervision, to identify exceptional OD candidates who are aligned to MED’s Purpose Promise, and Vision, internally referred to as our P2V2.

At MyEyeDr., you will have the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of patients. We are a high-growth healthcare company whose trusted community doctors and knowledgeable teams focus on helping our patients live their best lives by delivering an exceptional, personalized experience. Start your journey with MyEyeDr. -- join us on our mission to help people see, look, and be their very best.

job_descriptions.6fa413c2f64b714b:
at Kustomer
New York City, New York
About Kustomer

Kustomer is the omnichannel SaaS platform reimagining enterprise customer service to deliver standout experiences– not resolve tickets. Built with intelligent automation, Kustomer scales to meet the needs of any contact center and business by unifying data from multiple sources and enabling companies to deliver effortless, consistent and personalized service and support through a single timeline view.

Today, Kustomer is the core platform of some of the leading customer service brands like Ring, Rent the Runway, Glossier, Away, Glovo, Slice and UNTUCKit. Headquartered in NYC, Kustomer was founded in 2015 by serial entrepreneurs Brad Birnbaum and Jeremy Suriel, raised over $173.5M in venture funding, and is backed by leading VCs including: Tiger Global Management, Battery Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Cisco Investments, Canaan Partners, Boldstart Ventures and Social Leverage.

About the Role

As Kustomer’s Technical Talent Acquisition Partner, you will work closely with the VP of People on building a world class candidate experience. From a candidate’s first touch with Kustomer, you will be a guide, thought partner, and advisor for driving engagement with talent. You will act as a brand ambassador for our team, actively communicating our value proposition to the community through outreach, events, and talent marketing. As an internal influencer for talent, you will advise the leadership team on initiatives to successfully onboard people and integrate them into our culture and the broader Customer Experience industry.

You'll be responsible for:

Proactively sourcing active and passive technical talent against Kustomer’s hiring plans
Creating and maintaining a repeatable, scalable talent pipeline, leveraging data at every turn
Partnering with the VP of People on acquisition and retention initiatives
Analyzing our sourcing channels, continuously optimizing for return on investment
Owning hiring for our Tech and Product teams including stakeholder management and, as you grown in the role, strategic planning with those hiring managers
Building relationships with hiring managers, partnering closely with them to understand how to best expand their team and structure their organizations
Guiding the hiring process, asking questions to drive clarity and pushing back where appropriate
May involve handling sensitive personal data

Your qualities:

4-6 years experience - at least 2 as a technical recruiter in house
You’re determined to find the best talent, exploring new sources, relentlessly moving forward
You’ve hired for engineering, product, and design and know how to find and engage the best talent
You’re naturally curious, you ask questions and you don’t shy away from challenges
You’re a dynamic problem solver, always seeking solutions, leveraging relationships and resources
You’re attentive to the little details and you believe people's’ experience matters
You’re familiar with Google Apps and learning new technologies comes naturally to you
Experience with Greenhouse a plus
Agency experience a plus

Benefits

Kustomer offers an array of benefits including competitive salaries, stock options, 100% healthcare coverage, commuter benefits, and a flexible vacation policy.

Diversity & Inclusion at Kustomer

Kustomer is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status.
job_descriptions.a60eca8aa4164d0c:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:

Please note division and function examples are representative of opportunities common for this skill-set. The list is not exhaustive, and availability of open roles is determined based on business need. Specific roles will be confirmed through the interview process.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:

As a firm we believe our people are our most valuable asset. That’s why we have teams dedicated to designing and implementing strategies to help our people be their best – at the firm and in their lives outside of it.
From recruiters and learning practitioners to talent advisors and benefits experts, we aim to deliver a best-in-class people strategy that attracts and motivates our evolving workforce. Our Human Capital Management colleagues demonstrate strong problem-solving, quantitative analytics and stakeholder management skills and want to make an impact on the careers of our people.
Divisions and Job Functions

Human Capital Management While Human Capital Management (HCM) performs many of the functions traditionally associated with human resources, we do so with a strategic view of what it means to attract, develop and manage a global workforce. We recognize the high level of dedication our people give to Goldman Sachs and our clients. In turn, we are equally dedicated to making their experience at the firm a rewarding one through learning opportunities, a strong framework for career development, a health and wellness support system and a commitment to diversity and inclusion. Example teams include:
Talent Advisors advise leaders and empower managers to unleash the potential of our talent and ensure best-in-class people solutions by consulting the business on talent decisions, managing day-to-day people activities, and advising on people-related activities in order to enable the firm’s growth initiatives.
Talent Assessment designs, implements and advises on strategic frameworks to consistently identify and assess talent and inform people decisions from pre-hire through exit.
Recruiting is responsible for attracting, evaluating and hiring the broadest and most diverse pool of campus and experienced talent to ensure we drive our business into the future.
Learning & Engagement enables our people and teams to be at their best through a curriculum designed to strengthen our culture, accelerate transitions and drive commercial growth. Our learning experiences, tools and resources foster the growth of our people and create positive change in the firm.
Diversity & Inclusion drives the firm’s talent and diversity strategies by being a leading voice and advisor to the firm to achieve greater diverse representation through data, accountability, culture and brand taking a person-by-person approach to developing our leadership pipeline.
Reward designs best-in-class compensation and wealth creation programs that differentiate Goldman Sachs and enable us to attract and retain the best talent.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree (2017 – December 2019)
0-3 years of prior work experience in a relevant field.
Proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Strong ability to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines
Team player with positive attitude and strong work ethic
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ideal candidates will have strong quantitative and analytical skills
Candidates must demonstrate an ability to effectively communicate and present results highlighting the broader commercial and strategic impact.
Candidates should be comfortable developing relationships throughout the firm and building networks within the division as well as with other divisions
Upon joining the team, candidates should expect a challenging, fast-paced environment that will require the ability to focus on and deliver multiple projects effectively.
Demonstrated ability to think creatively, strategically, and operationally with a commercial mindset
Ability to understand, dissect and analyze data to drive decisions and/or make recommendations
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.


We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.


We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2020. All rights reserved.
Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity
job_descriptions.0e45d59843d3fbfc: Job DescriptionMassMutual Financial Services Professionals are key sources that clients turn to for their insurance, investment and financial strategies. Associates are responsible for putting together financial programs that will respond to client needs today and for the future. Our associates are business professionals who work with attorneys, accountants, and other executives. Many hold advanced degrees in business and finance, and designations in life underwriting and investment licenses. Whether it’s designing a retirement strategy planning for a college education, providing benefits for a business enterprise or protecting a family’s quality of life, you play a key role with the people you serve.Emerald Financial is the Central New Jersey firm representing MassMutual. Established in 1998, we have expanded and grown to four offices and have over 110 Financial Representatives and staff throughout New Jersey. We have multiple models for the new associates joining our team, whether you're a new college graduate looking for a solid training program and mentoring, a career changer looking for an opportunity to establish a career that will last, or an established producer looking for a firm that can take your practice to the next level and give you the support you need so you can focus on working with your clients. Emerald Financial has the support and know how to help you succeed no matter which background you are coming from.Emerald Financial Resources is a financial and insurance services organization which specializes in developing financial plans for individuals and families. In addition we work in the corporate market in areas such as employee benefits, executive compensation plans, retirement programs, insurance planning, and estate analysis. Our three-year training program is designed to help build a professional practice in financial services. A set level of compensation to start will transition into fees, commissions, and other elements of compensation that are driven by performance. Management opportunities are available. New representatives can be expected to earn as much as $75,000 to $100,000+ during their first year with significant growth potential thereafter. Our agency is located in Warren, NJ, but we can service the NY, NJ, and PA areas. Currently, we are interested in hiring for our NYC location.Financial Service Representative Responsibilities:In this entrepreneurial, consultative sales position, you will build your business by:· Prospecting for clients on a referral basis within clearly defined markets· Developing and maintaining long-term relationships with clients· Listening empathetically, gathering facts, analyzing needs and making responsible recommendations· Expanding personal knowledge and skills through joint work with fellow associatesRewards:Opportunity to control your time, your income and your own destinyTremendous satisfaction knowing that you are assisting your clients in protecting their financial futuresResults Equal Rewards: Unlimited earning potential based on your willingness to invest the time and effort needed to succeedWhat You Can Expect:CompensationYou want to be recognized for your skills, ability and performance - we get that. Our compensation philosophy is to pay for performance. We offer a total compensation plan that includes a competitive base salary and variable incentive opportunities, at all levels.Health & WelfareHaving access to health coverage is key to helping many people feel financially secure. If you work for MassMutual for 20 or more hours a week, you will be offered life, health, dental, disability and vision coverage. Health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts will also be made available.Work/Life BalanceYou have many responsibilities … at home, at work and in your community. We understand this and have an array of benefits and offerings to help employees achieve balance in their work and life.Planning for Your Financial FutureOur retirement program is just one of the many ways we recognize the important role our employees play in our success. We offer both a cash balance pension plan and a 401(k)/thrift plan to help employees prepare for their financial future.Job Types: Full-time, CommissionPay: $95,000.00 - $96,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee discountFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceLife insuranceRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:10 hour shift12 hour shift8 hour shiftDay shiftHolidaysMonday to FridayNight shiftOn callOvertimeWeekendsSupplemental Pay:Bonus payCommission paySigning bonusLicense/Certification:Life Insurance License (Required)Commission Only:YesWork Location:Fully RemoteOn the roadBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligible
job_descriptions.fc24f83e74b0bc05:
About Dorilton Capital:

Patience

We represent the investment office of a European family and have no fixed investment period. We prefer to create value over the long term by reinventing cash flow while avoiding excessive leverage.

Partnership

We work actively with existing management teams recognizing that long-term business success is the result of a team effort. Dorilton views its role as providing additional capital for acquisitions and growth projects and support and expertise to take its companies to the next level.

Continuity

We partner with companies that are led by strong management teams and have a successful history and culture. We firmly believe in our companies continuing with the elements that made them successful.

About the Recruiter role:

We are looking for a seasoned Recruiter to drive and implement recruiting strategies for Dorilton Capital and our portfolio companies. As a key member of our Human Resources team, you will build strong partnerships with internal stakeholders and candidates in order to effectively identify the best talent for our open roles. You will also be accountable for ensuring an amazing candidate experience throughout the entire recruiting process. Ultimately, you will help grow our teams with exceptional employees that will help us achieve our business goals.

Responsibilities:

Recruit, retain, and develop the best talent for the company

Develop market and job specific recruitment strategies to achieve hiring goals.

Design and implement national recruitment strategies to leverage our national scope and realize recruitment cost efficiencies

Develop a network of third-party acquisition professionals and manage relationships and negotiations

Create recruitment tools such as interview guides, training, templates and other resources Coach and counsel hiring managers on the full cycle hiring process and develop recruitment strategies that align with the business goals

Utilize recruiting data and metrics to inform key decisions and provide solutions

Develop and implement employer branding efforts and strategy

Attend recruiting events to build company presence and pipeline

Desired Skills:

You have a proven track record of success as a Recruiter and ideally have experience with regional recruiting

You are a high-energy influencer with a bias for action; you know how to lead and you know how to get things done

You have a proven-track record of driving talent success in fast-paced, rapidly-expanding companies

You are a fantastic and dynamic communicator. You know how to engage talent and build great relationships

You are a strong leader with impeccable organizational, strategic, analytical and project management skills
job_descriptions.7db405975d7e609e:
At Urbint, our mission is to create safer and more resilient communities using AI. We are passionate about taking data about our changing world – from climate, to urbanization, to infrastructure risk – and harnessing it to allow utilities and infrastructure operators to predict and prevent threats and meaningfully reduce field risk. We are a tight-knit team of coders, data scientists, infrastructure experts, entrepreneurs, and creatives working together to create and deliver cutting-edge technology to deliver insights that keep people safe.


We are looking to scale our organization rapidly for the foreseeable future, and are looking for an exceptional Senior Technical Recruiter to help fill a world-class, mission driven, organization with best in breed talent.

You:

You've driven hiring for both product and engineering roles at a tech-driven organization - you know what makes a successful product manager while being able to context switch and find and ideal SRE or engineer
"Quitting" is not in your lexicon. You're relentless, results-driven and passionate about hiring the right people, fast.
Are a natural at determining how and where to source to create a robust talent pipeline and you aren't afraid to use creative ways of leveraging multiple channels to drive interest.
You aren't afraid to try esoteric communities to drum up leads
You have the ability to wear many hats - from sourcing to closing, from data to strategy sessions - you enjoy and thrive wearing many hats
Hiring managers love you and rely on your expertise as a partner both in thought and execution
You think about operationalization and scale and think about how decisions now impact the future
You've preferably grown a team of recruiters, coordinators and/or sourcers and are passionate about providing a playbook for your team to thrive with varying levels of interjection.

Who You Are:

5+ years of professional experience in technical recruiting, preferably having been at an agency and inhouse at a hyper growth startup
Passionate about finding those who don't want to be found and operating against a high talent bar
You've closed candidates on your opportunity over the "who's who" of startup and tech organizations, who've also made compelling offers.
You understand how to pattern-match quickly and can map out what companies farm great talent and which technologies signify exceptional engineers to hunt.
Expertise in a modern ATS (preferably Greenhouse)
A data-driven approach to your work - you realize that hiring can be a subjective process, and you do all you can to make it as objective and quantitative as possible
Preferably have managed and mentored both high, middling and low performers
Benefits
Mission Driven - Some companies use AI to serve better digital ads and trade stocks, we seek to make our communities safer and more resilient
Top Compensation - Competitive compensation package
Best in Class Medical Coverage - 100% benefits and premiums paid
Health Perks - Wellness reimbursement and citibike membership
Weekly lunch stipend
Remote work monthly stipend


We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
job_descriptions.44aeab090a6d3139:
Campus Recruiter – NYC-based or Remote (East coast preferred)

At Penguin Random House, our mission is to foster a universal passion for reading by partnering with authors to help create stories and communicate ideas that inform, entertain, and inspire, and to connect them with readers everywhere. We believe in the power of books to connect us and change lives.
We have an incredibly exciting and highly visible new opportunity available within our Human Resources/Talent Acquisition team for a Campus Recruiter who is ready to make a positive impact on our organization and their own career.
Building relationships with schools and their students and alumni across the country, you’ll introduce people to terrific career opportunities in book publishing. Placing a special focus on schools with diverse enrollment, including but not limited to HBCUs and HACU member institutions, you’ll enable us to reach and cultivate relationships with students and alumni that continue to be underrepresented in the book publishing industry.
What you’ll do…
Take an instrumental part in building the company’s campus recruitment strategy, identifying target schools and groups, building schedules and developing a budget to execute the strategy
Identify opportunities and develop relationships with campus career centers, clubs and alumni groups to promote PRH and our many career opportunities
Source and screen candidates for our Internship Program
Perform full cycle recruitment for full time, entry-level positions throughout the year while ensuring an inclusive and equitable process
Manage and facilitate PRH’s attendance at career fairs and other on-campus and virtual recruiting events
Organize and host in-house and virtual career days for students and recent graduates
Coordinate with internal teams across the business to manage outreach efforts conducted by employees to their alma maters and divisional working groups
Report on recruiting and event metrics
Who you are…
A highly motivated contributor who is excited by our company’s mission
Passionate about removing barriers to entry and creating equitable processes in hiring
A culturally aware professional who thrives in an environment of building and maintaining relationships
A positive and supportive team member
A flexible and proactive problem solver who is extremely organized

What you’ll need to have...
Minimum 2 years’ work experience in at least one of these roles:
Recruiter (campus recruiting experience is highly preferred)
Closely related HR role
Career Development or similar role within higher education
These things will be helpful…
Experience working with Applicant Tracking Systems and capability of assessing results/data
Good knowledge of HBCU and HACU institutions
Knowledge & understanding of DEI best practices in regards to attracting talent, engagement and equitable candidate evaluation and selection
What we offer…
A competitive salary and attractive benefits package including, but not limited to:
Generous vacation, personal and sick day policy
Student loan support and tuition reimbursement programs
Discounted books and access to many titles on our E-reader app
An opportunity to build something within a well-established business and supportive team

This is an exempt role and hours may fluctuate based on travel and recruiting events
Domestic travel by car, train and/or plane required – up to 25%
Must have ability to lift up to 20 lbs of books and supplies
Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children’s publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 250 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children’s Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.

Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Company Description

Chili Piper helps businesses help their buyers.

People interested in your business typically have to wait hours or days after filling out a form. Not anymore. Our intelligent assistant offers them a simple way to book a meeting or start a phone call immediately upon form submission.

Unlike the traditional method of inbound lead management, Chili Piper uses smart rules to qualify and distribute leads to the right reps in real time. Our software also allows companies to automate opportunity distribution from their SDR's to their AE's, and book meetings from their marketing campaigns and live events.

Companies like Square, Twilio, DiscoverOrg, SalesLoft, and SiriusDecisions use Chili Piper to create an amazing experience for their leads, and in return experience higher conversions for their business.

Chili Piper is focused on helping Businesses help their Buyers - building a new category we call Buyer Enablement

Job Description

As the Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, you are the perfect fit for this role if you love identifying, assessing and bringing on board the most talented resources across all our departments to. We work globally and we take pride in building our company from all places of the world. The ideal candidate needs to have 4-5 years previous work with SaaS Talent Acquisition and is comfortable recruiting for customer facing and technical roles. We are looking for someone who has performed in a metric driven environment and has the ability to work in a fast paced environment. You will partner with leadership in driving a focus on understanding talent needs short and long term, fill key openings and drive processes and experimentation for our teams as a key talent business partner. This role reports to our CEO.

What You'll Do

Optimize and execute against the talent acquisition strategy to enable Chili Piper to continue along its growth trajectory (plans to triple headcount by the end of 2021).
Build the talent acquisition processes and infrastructure. You must have the experience and vision of creating a scalable recruiting strategy.
Execute the strategy by identifying & engaging the most talented resources in the marketplace.
Serve as a recruiting advisor and partner to the Executive team and be a critical driver of recruiting excellence across the organization.
Optimize and build our metrics-based approach to ensure that our goals are achieved on time, within budget and with quality
Lead and implement employer branding strategies.
Design, implement and maintain the appropriate processes, tools, systems and training necessary to scale and support a world-class team.
Own the entire recruitment process and candidate experience. You are skilled at recruiting customer facing roles and technical roles.
Build the outbound motion for recruiting at Chili Piper and define our outreach strategy as well as messaging for various roles.
Qualifications

What We're Looking For

You like to build from the ground up.
You like to move fast and have a vision for how to effectively scale our talent acquisition operations.
You have significant in-house technology recruitment experience.
Experience negotiating employee compensation packages.
A deep understanding of global employment as it pertains to hiring.
Proven organizational skills and the ability to focus intently on driving well qualified candidates to join our organization.
Proven ability to take initiative, use consultative skills and build strong, productive relationships

Additional Skills

4-5+ years of experience in SaaS Talent Acquisition.
3+ years of experience with ATS systems. Greenhouse ATS experience is preferred.
You are skilled in managing recruiting ads across various platforms
Proficient with negotiating salaries
Additional Information

How We Work

Freedom and flexibility. We're a 100% distributed team working from around the world. Our team members can work from wherever they want in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all hands meeting on Zoom.
Solve interesting problems. The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.
Autonomy and ownership. Working on a distributed team means you don't have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure you're getting things done. We're a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.
Be helpful. Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

The Perks

Unlimited Vacation
Company Offered 401k Plan
Generous Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
WeWork membership so you can work from anywhere
Any equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job
