job_descriptions.05468e9582bd5996:
*Open to remote applicants, preferably on the East Coast*

About Us

We’re a growing company. Everything we do, we do to help people grow. Our mission is to be a partner in progress on each unique journey to hair wellness. We provide personalized, natural solutions for healthy hair growth and connect people with doctors who care about hair. We challenge existing treatments and methodologies to continue to advance the frontier of hair science. As we help our customers grow, we grow too- through diversity & inclusion, teamwork & collaboration, and through empowering ourselves and others with our passion for wellness and innovation.

#KeepGrowing. It’s our mantra- a voice of encouragement for hair and humanity, motivating people to grow in the best ways possible: personally, spiritually, and exceptionally.

About You

Nutrafol is looking for a dynamic and proactive Recruiter. Reporting to the Talent Acquisition Manager, you’ll partner with the People & Talent team to continuously achieve hiring goals, and help create and refine processes.

In this role, you’ll oversee the entire process for assigned positions, from sourcing to hire. You will be responsible for hitting ambitious targets and ultimately building and maintaining a recruitment system that scales with the growing demands of our team.
We are a highly motivated, collaborative and fun team with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. If you're interested in joining a rapidly growing, creative, and innovative company, then this may be the perfect opportunity for you!

Responsibilities:

Manage all applicant screens and interviews for assigned positions.
Ensure a positive and uniform candidate experience by managing the coordination of timely communication of interviews with hiring managers.
Serve as the primary contact for your candidates and hiring managers throughout the interview process,
Manage all job postings to internal and external job boards to positions assigned to you.
Conduct employment verification and reference checks.
Partner closely with People Ops to ensure smooth transition and onboarding for new hires.
Extend verbal and written contingent job offers, including the negotiation of salaries.
Maintain and develop the library of job descriptions for the Nutrafol brand.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree.
2-3 years of solid end-to-end recruitment experience working across a wide range of roles at all levels.
Start-up experience strongly preferred.
Demonstrated ability to handle confidential and sensitive information.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
Highly organized, with a keen eye for details.
Strong technical and digital recruiting skills.
Strong analytical skills, ability to review data and make decisions accordingly.
A positive, self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit.
Team-player with a ‘no task too small’ attitude.
Ability to multi-task and wear multiple hats.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and G Suite.
Highly proficient with Greenhouse and LinkedIn Recruiter.

Bonus:

Experience or interest in the health & wellness space.

Company Perks
Great medical, dental and vision package.
Competitive salary.
401K with 50% match.
Flexible PTO
Free lunch on us every Tuesday and Thursday via Seamless/Grubhub
Two wellness breaks everyday
Virtual Happy Hours
Virtual Yoga and Meditation
One time allowance for home office setup
Free Nutrafol products shipped to you and access to in-house Naturopathic Doctors.
And more!
job_descriptions.54897794b1baab47:
What It’s All About
The New York Times is respected for its ambitious, high-quality journalism, which has earned it an unmatched number of Pulitzer Prizes, as well as its reach and influence. We are transforming the nation’s “newspaper of record” into a media-tech powerhouse. We have a Technology department of nearly 500 people, made up of talented engineers, data analysts, product and project managers, as well as designers. They speak at conferences and write about their work. More at: https://open.nytimes.com/
About the Role
As a Lead Recruiter, you will report to the Director of Tech and Product Recruiting and implement recruiting strategies to identify and attract qualified candidates for our Technology, Product and Product Design teams. Over the past few years, the New York Times has scaled its digital teams and we've built fair and efficient processes to meet our ambitious hiring goals.You’ll partner with our engineering and product teams on evaluating candidate experience, refining our recruiting processes, and you will continuously source qualified candidates on a national scale.
You will:
Identify and maintain an ongoing pool of candidates through strategic sourcing and research
Lead and implement the recruiting process, with an eye on potential improvements for fairness and efficiency
Work on some of our hardest to fill roles, which will require skilled sourcing and pipelining
Participate in industry conferences and events
Provide guidance and insight to management to help attract and retain top talent
Identify trends, issues and opportunities in the marketplace relevant to candidate pools
Coordinate with other departmental recruiters to assist with open positions on other teams
You are:
This isn’t your first recruitment role. You have at least 5+ years of experience with high-volume recruitment in tech and product, and full-cycle recruiting experience. You’re familiar with an applicant tracking system and recruiting tools/networks specific to this market.
Tech-focused. You understand the basics of tech development and can hire for skills relevant to different programming languages and required competencies.
You understand business and have experience hiring talent and partnering with business leaders who need to hire for those skills.
You know how to manage relationships for the long-term and have a built-in network of people who trust you. Leadership flocks to you as an adviser and confidante – not only for hiring – but as they develop and manage talent. Talent is drawn to you for the work you’ve done to build careers.
You have good instincts. You’re a multi-tasker who runs to – not from – a challenge. You’re able to work on multiple projects simultaneously and think independently.
#LI-AM1
The New York Times is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce, one that reflects the varied global community we serve. Our journalism and the products we build in the service of that journalism greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which can only come from diversity of all types, across our ranks, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do. It is also the smart thing for our business. So we strongly encourage women, veterans, people with disabilities, people of color and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.
The New York Times Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics. The New York Times Company will consider qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local "Fair Chance" laws.
job_descriptions.5d2c9e097d52423a:
Braze delivers customer experiences across email, mobile, SMS, and web. Customers, including Seamless, HBO, Disney, Urban Outfitters, and Venmo, use the Braze platform to facilitate real-time experiences between brands and consumers in a more authentic and human way. And we do it at scale – each month, tens of billions of messages are sent to a network of over 2 billion active users through Braze.

Need more proof? Braze was named a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Mobile Marketing Platforms in 2019. The company has also been named on the Forbes Cloud 100, Inc. Magazine’s 2019 Best Places to Work, and Crain's 2019 Best Places to Work in NYC lists.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

We’re looking for a world class Senior Technical Recruiter to help build and scale our Engineering and Product teams. This person should be excited to design and execute customized candidate recruiting plans while also being a point person for all things hiring with our hiring managers. In addition to this, they should also expect to:

Manage and own full technical recruitment lifecycle from end to end.
Find and engage candidates through creative sourcing techniques
Manage pipeline activity, maintain data integrity, and proactively share data-centric updates with internal stakeholders
Establish and maintain meaningful relationships across management and key cross-functional stakeholders internally
Collaborate with others on the Talent team on initiatives and/or hiring needs that may spike in other areas
Ensure that every candidate has a positive and engaging interview experience

WHAT YOU BRING

5+ years of full cycle tech recruiting experience, ideally at a high-growth startup.
Successful track record of attracting top senior engineering talent
Experience independently partnering with leadership on hiring initiatives
Ability to effectively drive toward results in a fast-paced environment
Creativity in problem-solving and resourcefulness across all stages of the hiring cycle
Detail-oriented, and have strong organizational skills
Excellent negotiation skills
Ability to work effectively in a highly team-based environment
Strong knowledge and interest in technology/engineering

WHAT WE OFFER

Competitive compensation that includes equity
Flexible time off policy to balance your work and life, including paid parental leave
Free daily lunch in the office, including snacks and beverages
Competitive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
Collaborative, transparent, and fun loving office culture

If you are a California resident subject to the California Consumer Privacy Act, click here to understand how Braze processes your personal information and how you can exercise your rights.
job_descriptions.a19926302b5b3b9f:
ABOUT FANDUEL GROUP

FanDuel Group is a world-class team of brands and products all built with one goal in mind — to give fans new and innovative ways to interact with their favorite games, sports, teams, and leagues. That's no easy task, which is why we're so dedicated to building a winning team. And make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we're committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give.

FanDuel Group is based in New York, with offices in California, New Jersey, Florida, Oregon and Scotland. Our brands include:

FanDuel— A game-changing real-money fantasy sports app
FanDuel Sportsbook— America's #1 sports betting app
TVG— The best-in-class horse racing TV/media network and betting platform
FanDuel Racing— A horse racing app built for the average sports fan
FanDuel Casino & Betfair Casino— Fan-favorite online casino apps
FOXBet — A world-class betting platform and affiliate of FanDuel Group
PokerStars US — The premier online poker product and affiliate of FanDuel Group

THE POSITION
Our roster has an opening with your name on it

We are committed to hiring best in class talent while providing a positive candidate experience and developing an exciting and respected employer brand. As a Recruiter on our team you will own the full cycle; candidate selection process, creating and sustaining a pipeline of talent to maintaining a high offer close rate. You will leverage your knowledge of FanDuel's business and functional requirements while partnering with hiring managers and the leadership team to drive the talent process. Key components include managing employer branding, developing job specifications, passive and active sourcing, inbound and outbound inquiries, interview strategies and final selection processes that ensure a strong fit and ability to impact organizational outcomes.

THE GAME PLAN
Everyone on our team has a part to play

Own entire recruitment lifecycle with innovative and creative liberty to drive business impact
Work cross functionally with other areas of HR to understand organizational design and role functions
Act as strategic partner to hiring managers in order to understand their recruitment needs to help them build a strong team
Build and maintain external networks by proactively searching for active and passive candidates through networks and active sourcing
Act as a brand ambassador by building and maintaining the FanDuel employment bran
Foster a positive candidate experience from initial reach out to close
Leverage systems and processes to track and support metrics for internal stakeholders
Work alongside HR Team to proactively identify talent challenges and then create impactful solutions to address them
Influence key stakeholders in the recruiting process through data and transparency to ensure deliverables in alignment with FanDuel's hiring strategy
Ensure the timely completion and collection of interview feedback and then orchestrating next steps in the process
Data driven and analytic approach to managing the process along with ongoing reporting of key metrics
Accountable for developing and maintaining a deep understanding of all requisitions within the company across business functions
Coach candidates through the interview process, ensuring they are prepared to meet the team
Structure new offers and work with compensation team to determine appropriate offer packages
Build and manage external relationships with local and national organizations, clubs, and other networks
Partner with marketing and our communications team to increase brand recognition

THE STATS
What we're looking for in our next teammate

2-4 years of recruiting experience in a fast-paced environment including prioritizing and managing multiple searches at once while delivering a high caliber of work
Understanding and executing the full recruitment lifecycle process (lead generation, managing the internal/external process, extending an offer and closing a candidate)
Highly skilled in leveraging sourcing tools such as LinkedIn and building passive pipelines
Ability to communicate, interact, influence and negotiate with a variety of internal clients and external candidates
Possess strong problem-solving, project management and program management skills
Strong team player who demonstrates interest and ability in contributing to the recruiting team success
Demonstrates adaptability and flexibility in the workplace
Possess excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills and are able to navigate complex situations
Experience with applicant tracking systems
Ability to problem solve and work autonomously with a sense of urgency
Bachelor's degree preferred

THE CONTRACT
We treat our team right

Competitive compensation is just the beginning. As part of our team, you can expect:

An exciting and fun environment committed to driving real growth
Opportunities to build really cool products that fans love
Mentorship and professional development resources to help you refine your game
Flexible vacation allowance to let you refuel
Hall of Fame benefit programs and platforms

FanDuel Group is an equal opportunities employer. Diversity and inclusion in FanDuel means that we respect and value everyone as individuals. We don't tolerate bias, judgement or harassment. Our focus is on developing employees so that they reach their full potential.
job_descriptions.0bc172a7bf860e75:
Catholic Health Services of Long Island (CHS) is an integrated health care delivery system with some of the region's finest health and human services agencies. CHS includes six hospitals, three skilled nursing facilities, a regional home nursing service, hospice and a multiservice, community-based agency for persons with special needs. Under the sponsorship of the Diocese of Rockville Centre, CHS serves hundreds of thousands of Long Islanders each year, providing care that extends from the beginning of life to helping people live their final years in comfort, grace and dignity.
Position Summary
We have an exciting opportunity to join our growing Talent Acquisition team, here at CHS! If you are passionate about recruitment, thrive in a fast-paced healthcare environment and are ready to take the next step in your career, join us in transforming the way employers and job seekers connect.


In this role, the Talent Acquisition Manager will be responsible for the oversight of pipelining, recruiting, interviewing, and selection of qualified applicants for Catholic Health Services of Long Island. In this role the Manager will also supervise, train and develop staff within the team on an ongoing basis.

Job Responsibilities
Assists with overseeing the Talent Acquisition process and candidate experience for positions that are recruited for by the team.
Direct supervision of staff, as well as, provides support to the Vice President of Talent Acquisition in hiring, managing and training staff for the department.
Sources and recruits for leadership and CHS corporate positions.
Develop and implement programs to attract and target viable candidates.
Conducts audits and check-ins with recruiters to ensure services are being performed in a timely manner.
Monitor's team's performance and makes recommendations for change and efficiency
Collects and analyzes data to prepare reports to measure success rates for customer service, time to fill, trend data. Provides feedback with regards to the success rate of the team members. Manages projects independently. Oversees and approves the projects the team is working on to ensure that they are meeting their deadlines.
All other duties assigned.


Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management or related field.
Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in Human Resources or Talent Acquisition of which at least 2 years must be in a supervisory role.
Corporate or Healthcare experience required.
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office, Applicant Tracking Systems plus (Lawson, Healthcare Source preferred).
Effective oral written communication skills, as well as, consultative skills with the ability to understand the needs and urgency of assigned customer base are essential.
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
Must have experience in recruiting for leadership positions.
Master's Degree preferred.
At Catholic Health Services of Long Island your well-being comes first, with comprehensive compensation and benefits; our offerings go beyond the basics. In addition to multiple medical plans, life insurance, generous paid time off and flexible spending accounts, we also offer substantial tuition reimbursement, an employer funded pension plan and several savings plan options for your future.
job_descriptions.84259dd11be81570:
LIFESTANCE OVERVIEW
LifeStance Health is a private equity-backed, behavioral health company focused on providing medically driven, evidenced-based treatment services for adolescents and adults suffering from mental health issues in a variety of settings. LifeStance is backed by TPG Capital and is pursuing an aggressive acquisition and de novo growth strategy to drive expansion.
LifeStance is led by successful healthcare entrepreneurs, who among other things, started and scaled Accelecare Wound Centers, one of the nation’s largest providers of outpatient wound care services. Under their leadership and with the support of two leading private equity firms, LifeStance is acquiring and developing successful behavioral health practices across the United States and, in doing so, working to provide the best mental health care available.
As part of this strategy, LifeStance seeks to identify and recruit ‘up-and-coming’ talent eager to join a growth stage company to work closely with an experienced team dedicated to providing the highest quality of care and compassion to individuals with mental health issues.
ROLE OVERVIEW
LifeStance is seeking a self-starter, passionate and persistent Practice Development Director to support multiple platforms operating in the behavioral health space. This position will focus on providing professional physician recruitment across locations nationwide and act as the primary contact between senior leadership, physician practices and potential candidates.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Act as the link between physician practice and potential employee, recruiting high caliber candidates based upon the explicit needs of the physician practice
Develop and implement recruitment strategies using traditional and non-traditional resources
Research new and innovative methods of recruitment, source across multiple resources, generate leads, build a robust pipeline of qualified candidates, review candidate resumes, conduct interviews, and negotiate and close offers
Build solid working relationships and provide the highest level of service to all internal and external stakeholders
Fill job openings with qualified physicians and ensure hiring targets are met in timely and effective manner
Qualify physician candidates by confirming job qualifications – MD/DO degree, state licensure, board certifications, Medicare/Medicaid certifications and DEA licensure

PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's Degree in related field or equivalent experience required
3-5 years of experience in physician recruitment required
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Effectively manage a high volume of emails and calls on a daily basis
Ability to manage time appropriately and meet deadlines
Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Effective negotiation skills
Resourceful in recruiting techniques
Ability to execute daily tasks with limited supervision
Must be flexible, adaptable and well organized
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Technologically savvy with experience working Applicant Tracking Systems
Must possess a strong background in developing and implementing recruitment strategies using traditional and non-traditional resources
Demonstrates awareness, inclusivity, sensitivity, humility, and experience in working with individuals from diverse ethnic backgrounds, socioeconomic statuses, sexual orientations, gender identities, and other various aspects of culture
LifeStance Health is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

Compensation
Top compensation over $150,000 (includes base salary and bonuses)Comprehensive benefits package (all insurances w/ 4% match to 401K)

job_descriptions.b738818b3ea7d98a:
Talent Acquisition is a strategic driver of HomeAdvisor's success and we are growing! We have a world-class, fun loving team working in concert to drive our global ambitions. As recruiters, we conceive practical and creative ways to surface leading talent, and we invest in activating passive candidates through a highly engaged approach. We accomplish this by partnering closely with leadership to hire colleagues who love what they do, are brilliant in their capabilities and want to be part of something that is greater than themselves.

At HomeAdvisor, we create the digital tools and services that empower millions of service professionals to connect with hundreds of millions of homeowners. We are a dual-sided marketplace that nurtures growth of the independent small business and delivers a seamless experience in home improvement. As #1 in the home services category, our tremendous scale is the launchpad to boundless inventions in technology and product!

ABOUT THE JOB:

We are looking for a full-cycle recruiter who will also help us to build out a recruiting platform that is truly best in class. You must be a self-starter, comfortable managing hard to fill roles, and work well without constant supervision. You will be responsible for working with hiring managers to implement creative sourcing techniques, recruit talented candidates, and screen applicants for positions across the platform. You will be developing and executing on sourcing strategies that are measurable, focused on continuous improvement, & results oriented.

Responsibilities
Manage the full life-cycle recruitment process for multiple senior open positions including developing job descriptions, posting positions, sourcing prospective candidates, screening and interviewing candidates
Collaborate to develop a compelling recruitment strategy to hire according to projected staffing plans and increase recruiting's efficiency
Develop strong hiring manager partnerships and empower them to make informed hiring decisions
Collaborate with a diverse range of hiring managers to teach hiring managers more effective interviewing and assessment skills
Ensure the best candidate experience throughout Handy's interview processes
Use social media and company branding to attract the right candidates and build ongoing relationships
Come up with creative messaging for drip campaigns across roles
Ensure each message we send out is personalized to the candidate's experience and in line with the Handy Talent Brand
Find a way to provide and message a competitive advantage within our industry
Iterate! We're a collaborative team, so if you see something that could be better, we want to know
Qualifications
BA/BS degree from an accredited college or university. Focus in recruiting and demonstrated interest in technology strongly preferred
4-5 years of recruiting experience with an executive search firm or tech company
Demonstrated success in filling a variety of roles at all levels
Ability to understand business objectives and culture and translate these to hiring requirements
Must be flexible with the ability to adjust a search as business requirements change
Must be able to take advantage of recruiting-related software, including Applicant Tracking Systems and sourcing through internet resources and social media websites
You're exceptionally detail-oriented and organized; you have the ability to manage competing priorities
Familiarity with a variety of the technology field's concepts, practices, and procedures in addition to local, state and federal laws
Must have excellent communications skills, both written and verbal
Strong sense of urgency, ability to prioritize, and excellent organizational skills
Strong interviewer and negotiator who is able to sell an opportunity to job applicants
Ability to assess technical skills and to learn from the hiring managers and current employees what a best in class candidate looks like

MORE ABOUT US:
We are shaping what it means to be Rocky Mountain Tech. We are known for our casual atmosphere that is flexible and focused on productivity. With a generous "take what you need" vacation policy, thoughtful approach to career development, and the ability for individuals to make a tangible impact, we are a true meritocracy and fundamentally believe our people are our greatest asset.

HomeAdvisor is the self-contained operating business of ANGI Homeservices (NASDAQ: ANGI), a federation of spirited technology companies that build for a better economy. We love the software that we invent, the millions of service professionals whom we empower and the hundreds of millions of homeowners whose lives we beautify. As a purposeful technology company, we foster a culture of collaboration, and nurture growth through innovation. We are proud to be recognized as a Top Workplace in Denver for 6 years and counting!

If you've made it this far along our post, this probably sounds a lot like you and where you want to thrive! We would be delighted to have the opportunity to start the conversation!

Digital Marketing Analyst - Up to $80k/y + $10k bonus + Equity

SAM Labs is a fast growing and award-winning EdTech start-up. Founded in 2014, growing fast, making a difference, and venture capital funded. With over 4,000 school customers in 60+ countries already using SAM Labs products and lesson materials, SAM Labs is looking for more talent to join its team!

SAM Labs inspires generations of problem solvers with Coding and STEAM. We empower teachers with innovative curriculum resources, tools, and the mindset to do so. Teachers and students learn with SAM Labs kits and lessons by designing anything from energy efficient lighting grids for 'smart' cities to solar-powered habitats for endangered species - all the while meeting curriculum standards.

As the Digital Marketing Analyst, you will leverage your analytical and automation skill sets to empower data-driven growth of our customer base. You will report directly to the Director of Marketing. The position has a starting compensation of up to $80k + $10k bonus - dependent on qualifications, potential, and experience.

To set you up for success, we have researched and analyzed exhaustively which regions, districts, and schools would respond positively to Coding and STEAM. Using a data driven approach, we have also refined a process maximizing your chances of success. You will work alongside very bright, passionate and talented marketing team members. The Global team in the USA, Europe, the Middle East, and Asia will be supporting your success every step of the way as well.

Driven by passion, data and collaboration, we're on a mission to be the leading player in the future of education. As the Digital Marketing Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our continued growth and success.

At SAM Labs we are optimists. We value creativity, action, hard work, ownership, transparency and fun. If you do too, join us!

You will:

Conduct lead and customer data analysis to identify patterns, drive insights, and opportunities to fuel strategic and targeted decisions.
Produce campaign segmentation lists for email, other marketing channels and initiatives
Develop automation workflows to generate efficiencies in current and new processes
Develop and maintain robust, dynamic, and highly visual reports and KPI dashboards to answer key business questions
Leverage various BI tools sets and technology to assist with data storytelling and insights
Provide strategic input with regards to enhancing and upgrading marketing technology and business intelligence stacks
Contribute to integration projects and perform testing and validation for various IT enhancements within marketing and business intelligence technologies

You:

Proven ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw conclusions
Strong ability to translate raw data into actionable insights and drive business decisions
Proficient in reporting and analyzing consumer data
Experience using campaign reporting and visualization tools
Implement lead scoring best practices to enable higher conversions of quality leads
Have a good understanding of campaign workflows
Measure campaign results and optimize our lead nurturing workflows for segments to convert more leads through to customers
Proficiency with Hubspot or other marketing automation technology
Highly organized, methodical and process-driven, demonstrating a drive to improve internal processes whenever possible
Proven analytical, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills - ability to get around roadblocks
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Outlook and similar GSuite tools
Ability to design A/B testing on automated marketing campaigns to maximize results
Segment audiences to optimize campaigns and increase the effectiveness
Report on all campaigns and make changes where necessary
Experience in database management
Ability to flex as a team player on work assignments / projects as they arise
Experience with editing tools such as Photoshop for image resizing a plus
Self-starter – the team is always busy and we don't like micro-managing
Education experience a plus


Reporting to:

Director of Marketing


Benefits:


At SAM Labs we move at high speed and will provide you with immense opportunities for initiative, creativity and ownership. In addition to that we have created the following 'more tangible' benefits for you:


5 days vacation + 4 days personal time + 6 days holidays + 1 day per year up to 20 max
Sick days in line with statutory requirements
Personal Development & Training Allowance
401K offered and company contribution towards medical, dental and sick leave.
Waiting period may apply

SAMLabs.com

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Work Location:

USA based candidates given preference.

Work Remotely:

Fully Remote

Barrel is a creative and digital marketing agency. We work with growing brands to build digital platforms and launch marketing campaigns. Clients include L’Oreal, Amazon, Barry’s, Well+Good, Dr. Jart+, and Scholastic as well as various emerging consumer lifestyle brands.

We are looking for a Marketing Intern to join our Marketing Strategy & Business Intelligence (MSBI) team this Fall and Winter. This is a paid internship program that has the opportunity to lead to a full time position for the right person.

As Marketing Intern, you will work alongside our team members and build experience by developing content, coming up with ideas, and developing reports and analyses for various marketing campaigns across social, paid, email, and web. You will receive guidance and feedback along the way and also have various opportunities to contribute to real client projects.

We are currently looking for a Marketing Intern to join our remote-first team. You can work from anywhere as long as you are able to work for the majority of our Eastern Time work hours of 10AM to 6PM.

Examples of What You Might Do

On a given day you might:

Diving into the data to identify key trends in a site’s user behavior so that we can improve site performance and user experience.
Doing keyword research to identify content opportunities for an ecommerce brand.
Working with designers and developers to design the user experience for a subscription service.
What we’re looking for
A passion for growing businesses through digital marketing and conversion strategies with strong interest in data analysis and user experience.
Strong research and analytical mindset.
Familiarity with web design and usability best practices and trends.
Comfortable working in Google Apps (Docs, Sheets, etc)
Knowledge of HTML/CSS, Facebook Ads, Google Analytics/Adwords/Tag Manager, email marketing platforms (Mailchimp, Klaviyo etc), or Adobe Creative Suite are a plus.
Positive Attitude: enthusiastic and able to contribute at any given stage throughout the process; actively takes the lead on a given task and can pitch in wherever help is needed.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; able to confidently express ideas and also knows when to listen.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
What you’re excited about
Helping to grow and develop processes within our Marketing Strategy & Business Intelligence Team and company-wide
Collaborating closely with talented team members on fast-paced projects that see immediate impact
Advising new and exciting brands on their marketing and ecommerce activities and working directly with the client to roll out
enhancements and new campaigns
Generating fresh and creative ideas on ways to raise the profile of the brand and to turn audiences into new customers

Barrel offers competitive salary, health/dental/vision coverage, paid vacation, half-day Fridays all year round, remote home setup stipend, and a professional development stipend. Most importantly, we work on projects that truly impact our clients’ businesses and attract team members who love to be challenged with tough problems and fast-paced work.

We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.
How we LEAD:
Republic Records is looking for a dynamic Marketing Coordinator to support the Marketing Department. The ideal candidate will be an organized, detail-oriented person, who can easily handle the coordinator duties listed below, as well as someone who can take on more responsibilities as they get established in the role. This will be a great opportunity for someone who can handle the day-to-day workload and will also be motivated to identify ways to contribute to the department.
In this dynamic position, the Pop Marketing Coordinator will serve as a key member of the marketing team. The ideal candidate will possess extremely strong administrative, organizational, and creative skills. In addition, they should have a sense of urgency, eagerness to take initiative, outside the box approach, resourcefulness, and strong interpersonal communication skills. Prior marketing and administrative experience in the music/entertainment field is required.
How you’ll CREATE:
Manage quarterly budget for roster including handling reservations, fund transfers, vendor setup, create requisitions, facilitate PO approval, rush requests, invoice troubleshooting, and vendor relations. Must have Uniport experience.
Assist the Marketing Strategists with the implementation of various marketing & advertising campaigns.
Manage artist promo schedules, coordinate artist travel & update artist growth
Initiate and coordinate the design and manufacturing of promo and merch items such as posters, stickers, shirts, hoodies, etc.
Draft agreements for music videos and independent contractors, as well as various authorization forms
Assist with managing and organizing showcases, and events
Participate in external artist related events such as shows, music festivals, and promo visits.
Liaise with other departments including Radio, Publicity, Digital, A&R, Commerce, Finance, and Production.
Collect, organize, and circulate all artist assets including photos, artwork, logos, music, bio, teasers, etc.- separate by marketing strategist
Create and update all artist marketing decks, marketing timelines, and other project-related documents.
Assist with administrative and day to day duties including:
Answering and screening calls
Managing calendars and coordinating incoming requests
Setting up meetings and conference calls
Booking travel, accommodations, and car services
Track expenses and submit monthly expense reports in a timely and accurate manner
Order office supplies
Manage audio and video release schedule documentation for both domestic and international releases.
Communicate marketing drivers and pitch information for upcoming releases to digital streaming partners, including Spotify, Apple Music, Digster.fm, Vevo, YouTube, Pandora, Beatport, Amazon, etc.
Distribute marketing agendas and record meeting minutes to circulate afterwards.
Use analytics tools to generate weekly reports on platforms such as Artist Portal, Swift, Mediabase, Spotify For Artists, Music Connect, Chartmetric, Next Big Sound, Buzz Angle, Shazam Music Insights, LinkFire, etc.
Any additional duties as assigned.
Bring your VIBE:
2+ years of experience in office administrative capacity (music industry or marketing preferred)
Experience working with Microsoft Word - Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
Proficiency in Adobe creative suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere) preferred
BS/BA (Business Administration or Marketing preferred)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Must be self-directed and extremely well organized.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. Must be able to work under time constraints.
Ability to multi-task and juggle competing priorities.
Perks Playlist:
Competitive Compensation Package including Salary, Benefits and Generous 401k Savings Plan
Paid Time Off – Paid Holidays, “Gift Week”, Summer Fridays
Student Loan Repayment Assistance
Employee Developmental Support
Annual Gym Reimbursement Package
Pet Insurance, plus much more!
 Universal Music Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About The Brand
ViacomCBS (NASDAQ: VIAC; VIACA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic consumer brands, its portfolio includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, CBS All Access, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. The company delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, ViacomCBS provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions for partners on five continents.
Overview and Responsibilities
The ViacomCBS Trade marketing team is a creative and tactical organization that delivers an ‘always on’ marketing strategy for ViacomCBS and its audiences which include Advertisers, Marketers, Distributors and Content Partners, Investors, Current and prospective employees, and all those interested in the collective ViacomCBS story. It is this team’s responsibility to insure our trade and corporate audiences know what sets us apart, our strategic vision, and key successes as we deliver upon that vision. This team aspires to be the most creative trade marketing team in the industry and requires a leader who will live that vision every day.

ViacomCBS seeks an entry-level marketer who is motivated by the unique opportunity to build and scale the story of ViacomCBS, as we continue to evolve and shape ourselves and the industry. The Coordinator will support various internal and external assignments for ViacomCBS, working closely with the Ad Sales, Distribution Content Licensing , TA, OGI and Brand teams. You will support trade and corporate marketing initiatives that are aligned to the strategic objectives of the company and its brands.

Candidates should be passionate about culture, with strong interpersonal skills, and able to contribute to a wide variety of projects. You are motivated and super creative but also focused and organized. You love the ViacomCBS brands, are excited for our growth and diversification, and embody our values of bravery, empathy, and integrity.

Day-to-day responsibilities:
Support project management of campaigns by collaborating with internal functional teams across social, editorial, creative, communications and events; coordinate project timelines, budget allocations, and materials creation
Support marketing ideas designed to highlight the creativity, thought-leadership, talent and innovation of ViacomCBS
Collaborate with team to create campaign briefs for key stakeholder-driven initiatives
Maintain ad sales website by creating content and tracking usage metrics to find opportunities for improvement.
Work with ViacomCBS Editorial team to pitch stories and content on behalf of our partners
Work with ViacomCBS Digital & Social team to brief in / ideate social and paid media support on behalf of our partners
Assist in creation and maintenance of collateral, sales decks, and swag
Prepare reports/recaps of ViacomCBS Marketing campaigns and events and support partner reporting and feedback
Support team with basic administrative duties including but not limited to raising of POs, budget tracking, and team event coordination

Basic Qualifications
Minimum 2-3 years of experience in marketing, advertising, or communications
Additional Qualifications
Super creative and passionate about getting the job done
Ability to project-manage from start to finish (and manage up, when necessary)
Interest in marketing, strategy, and media/entertainment
Excellent written, verbal communication, and presentation skills
Flexibility, initiative, appetite for dynamic environment
Strong interpersonal, relationship-development skills
Effective problem-solver with “can-do” attitude
Excellent attention to detail and strong PowerPoint skills
Well-organized with a strong ability to prioritize and a master at multi-tasking
Fan of ViacomCBS brands!

job_descriptions.7be5dc7d5c66b938: Position SummaryReporting to the Dean, the Chief Marketing and Communications Officer sets strategy and directs execution for marketing, public relations, and communications goals for all programs and departments of Columbia Business School. The Chief Marketing and Communications Officer oversees the areas of Marketing, Communications and Public Relations, and is responsible for all internal and external communications for the School, including digital technology and social media as appropriate.The candidate has responsibility for the School’s branding strategy and has oversight on implementing that brand identity throughout the School including on the website, print media, marketing collateral, and all communications to internal and external stakeholders. The Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will manage a team of officers of administration.ResponsibilitiesThe Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will plan and direct a coordinated communications, public relations and marketing strategy in support of Columbia Business School priorities: bridging academic theory and real-world practice; providing a world-class education that supports a lifetime career of business leadership and entrepreneurial thinking; and supporting the School’s community of students, faculty, staff and alumni.Working with the dean and School senior staff, the Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will drive efforts to continue to distinguish and enhance the brand of the institution through all communications to the public, and manage media, print and web communications; direct information through media organizations and constituencies of the School.The Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will work closely with the Vice Dean of Research to create a strategy for faculty research promotion to ensure that both internal and external stakeholders are aware of faculty impact beyond what is taught in the classroom. This strategy must include the website, media outreach, School-sponsored conferences and events, marketing materials, internal magazines and postings, and social media.The Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will maintain the social media presence for the dean in LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, and on the School’s website.The Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will be responsible for the implementation of the School’s new website, ensuring that stakeholder needs are addressed and deadlines are met.The Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will have direct responsibility for marketing and communications for the MBA, Executive MBA and Executive Education programs and will oversee communications for other School centers, programs and departments. Measure the performance of all activities and campaigns, assess them against goals, and adjust tactics when necessary to achieve goals. Provide ongoing reporting, develop actionable insights, test and learn new approaches. Conduct thorough analyses on marketing ROI and successfully develop cost effective solutions.The Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will develop strategy to increase visibility and frequency of positive media interaction of faculty, the dean and alumni of the School. Promote the School’s reputation and influence among peer business schools, prospective students and their families, alumni, and the mediaThe Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will work with the Vice Dean for External Relations and Development and the Executive Director of Alumni and Corporate Relations to provide guidance on and support for communications to alumni and corporate partners.The Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will manage the dean’s communications internally and externally. S/he must capture the dean’s voice in communications internally and externally for events including commencements, orientations, welcome and update emails to faculty, staff, students, alumni, and Board members.The Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will work with the Executive Director of Public Relations and oversee tactical aspects of the School’s PR program, including third-party rankings, collaborations with business media, outreach metrics and branded merchandise.The Chief Marketing and Communications Officer will advise the dean’s Senior Staff in matters of internal and crisis communications with students, faculty and staff and be the liaison with the University on a coordinated messageS/he will evaluate and prioritize the print and publication program of the School as well as hold an advisory role with the CBS Publishing imprint.Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree required. Advanced degree strongly preferred. Minimum of 8–10 years’ experience in progressively responsible roles in marketing and/or communications required, including at least four years in marketing.Must have demonstrated excellent written, oral, interpersonal communication, organizational and follow-through skills. Writing and editing experience necessary, as well as managerial experience in supervising projects and/or directing the activities of communications and marketing staffs. Must have the ability to lead and work in a high volume, high demand, and highly collaborative, supportive, team oriented office. Must be organized, creative, enterprising, persuasive, and tactful. job_descriptions.fd0d1007d5e32a18:
CREATIVITY IS OUR SUPERPOWER. It’s our heritage and it’s also our future. Because we don’t just make toys. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. Mattel is at its best when every member of our team feels respected, included, and heard—when everyone can show up as themselves and do their best work every day. We value and share an infinite range of ideas and voices that evolve and broaden our perspectives with a reach that extends into all our brands, partners, and suppliers.


The Opportunity:

Fisher-Price is currently seeking an Associate Manager, Global Brand Marketing – Marketing Communications. The Associate Manager of Global Brand Marketing – Marketing Communications will support the brand team in driving relevance of the Thomas & Friends and Fisher-Price brands with today’s parents. This includes supporting the development of brand marketing efforts and key product communications to ensure we are connecting with parents in a meaningful way and driving demand for key lines of business. This also includes supporting the Marketing Communications department in elevating the look and feel and tone of voice of all branded assets, as well as driving consistency of the brand’s identity across all consumer touchpoints.



What Your Impact Will Be:

Support the development of a new brand platform for the Thomas & Friends brand. Collaborate with external agency partners and internal cross-functional teams to develop the launch campaign and roll out for this new platform. This includes project management of the development of campaign strategy, tactics, and associated asset development.
Facilitate global adaptation of Thomas & Friends brand strategy and campaign by socializing campaign developments, addressing feedback from global counterparts, and ensuring assets are delivered to global partners in a timely manner.
Coordinate with key leads across the Thomas & Friends franchise (social, PR, live events, content) to ensure that all activations of the brand ladder up to the brand’s platform and strategy. Provide messaging guidance as needed.
Support the Fisher-Price brand team with brand campaign and branded asset creation as needed. This may include, but is not limited to: social media campaigns, retail signage, e-commerce asset creation, digital content, email, TV or digital product advertising and other brand/PR activations.
Support the Fisher-Price brand team with brand campaign and branded asset creation as needed. This may include, but is not limited to: social media campaigns, retail signage, e-commerce asset creation, digital content, email, TV or digital product advertising and other brand/PR activations.

What We're Looking For:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing/Business or related (or equivalent); MBA preferred.
5-7 years of similar consumer product marketing experience (or MBA with 3-5 years’ experience).
Product Development experience required
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels.
Strong organizational skills as well as strong communication skills (written and verbal).
Ability to handle a high volume of work while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail.
Computer proficiency: MS Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint.
Must be a self-starter with a proactive approach to work.
Ability to work independently as well as be a team player.
Ability to prioritize work in order to meet important deadlines.
Strong analytical skills
Strong strategic thinking skills
Solid presentation skills.
Excellent follow up skills.

What It’s Like to Work Here:
We are a purpose driven company aiming to empower the next generation to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. We live up to our purpose employing the following behaviors:

We collaborate: Being a part of Mattel means being part of one team with shared values and common goals. Every person counts and working closely together always brings better results. Partnership is our process and our collective capabilities is our superpower.

We innovate: At Mattel we always aim to find new and better ways to create innovative products and experiences. No matter where you work in the organization, you can always make a difference and have real impact. We welcome new ideas and value new initiatives that challenge conventional thinking.

We execute: We are a performance driven company. We strive for excellence and are focused on pursuing best in class outcomes. We believe in accountability and ownership and know that our people are at their best when they are empowered to create and deliver results.

Who We Are:
Mattel is a leading global toy company and owner of one of the strongest catalogs of children’s and family entertainment franchises in the world. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. We engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic brands, including Barbie, Hot Wheels, Fisher-Price, American Girl, Thomas & Friends, UNO and MEGA, as well as other popular intellectual properties that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies. Our offerings include film and television content, gaming, music and live events. We operate in 35 locations and our products are available in more than 150 countries in collaboration with the world’s leading retail and ecommerce companies. Since its founding in 1945, Mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in empowering children to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential.

Visit us at https://jobs.mattel.com/ and www.instagram.com/MattelCareers.

Mattel is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer where we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day. We welcome all job seekers including minorities, females, veterans, individuals with disabilities, and those of all sexual orientations and gender identities.

job_descriptions.6c5a9743ab1a2fe8:
THE ROLE

Peloton is seeking a confident Administrative Assistant to support the Global Marketing and Product Marketing teams, primarily focused on providing active support for Peloton's VP of Global Media & CRM and VP of Global Brand & Strategic Marketing. This person will report to the Executive Assistant heading these teams and will work alongside the lead Executive Assistant in supporting the needs of these critical teams. The person in this role must be detail-oriented, highly-organized, and a smart communicator, in addition to being a resourceful problem-solver and relationship builder. The ideal candidate will have a can-do attitude and someone who is excited by working in a fast-paced environment. This position is full-time, based in Peloton's New York City headquarters.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage the calendars of each executive with a high level of detail and prepare daily/weekly briefs for them
Coordinate internal and external meetings for executives and their teams
Communicate with internal team members and external partners on behalf of the executives
Handle logistics for meetings, including booking conference room space, organizing agendas, preparing materials, and ensuring availability of attendees
Manage domestic and international travel arrangements ensuring tight schedules and well articulated agendas
Prepare expense reports and purchase requisitions including monthly expense reconciliation and on-demand travel expense reports
Uphold a strict level of confidentiality
Arrange and execute team building, offsites, and social events
Be a competent right hand to the Executive Assistant supporting the Global Marketing & Product Marketing Teams
Capable of handling ad-hoc work as it comes
QUALIFICATIONS
2-3 years of work experience
Highly organized with strong communication skills and emotional intelligence
Ability to strategically multitask and prioritize projects
Strong time and project management skills
Creative, collaborative, curious, and innovative thinker
Ability to work independently as well as with a team
Capable of working with diverse personalities
Impeccable integrity and ethical standards
Ability to calmly and resourcefully navigate past obstacles
True team player across the company
A friendly and personable personality to work as a Strategic Partner across the entire team
Experience with Concur or like accounting tool a plus
Experience with Google's GSuite tools (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Slides, etc.) a plus
Experience with Slack a plus
ABOUT PELOTON

Peloton is the largest interactive fitness platform in the world with a loyal community of more than 2.6 million Members. The company pioneered connected, technology-enabled fitness, and the streaming of immersive, instructor-led boutique classes for its Members anytime, anywhere. Peloton makes fitness entertaining, approachable, effective, and convenient, while fostering social connections that encourage its Members to be the best versions of themselves. An innovator at the nexus of fitness, technology, and media, Peloton has reinvented the fitness industry by developing a first-of-its-kind subscription platform that seamlessly combines the best equipment, proprietary networked software, and world-class streaming digital fitness and wellness content, creating a product that its Members love. The brand's immersive content is accessible through the Peloton Bike, Peloton Tread, and Peloton App, which allows access to a full slate of fitness classes across disciplines, on any iOS or Android device, Fire TV, Roku, Chromecast and Android TV. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in New York City, Peloton has a growing number of retail showrooms across the US, UK, Canada and Germany. For more information, visit www.onepeloton.com.
job_descriptions.9fff00c8d43dfcab:
Founded in 1925, Random House is the proud publishing house of many of the world’s most acclaimed storytellers, thought leaders, and innovators. Our host of imprints publish original fiction and nonfiction in all formats with the mission to entertain, educate, and inspire readers for generations.
We are currently seeking a Publicity Assistant to join the Random House publicity department. Supporting the VP Director of Publicity and the Associate Director of Publicity for Random House on publicity campaigns for both fiction and non-fiction hardcover and paperback titles. Authors these publicist work with include Ibram X. Kendi, Ta-Nehisi Coates, Elizabeth Strout, Kurt Andersen, Chuck Wendig, Jeff Shaara, George Saunders, and Tara Westover, among others. This position provides an intensive education in trade book publishing in a fast-paced, exciting, and highly collaborative environment.

Responsibilities include:

Assistance in carrying out high-impact publicity campaigns, notably in literary fiction, narrative non-fiction, history, cultural exposé, and books that explore various aspects of social justice. This role is charged with aiding the Director of Publicity of the Random House, Dial Press and Modern Library imprints with administrative duties, high-profile project work, and media and event relations. The role also supports the Associate Director of Publicity organizing the logistics of author tours, securing various media, crafting press materials, research for press outreach and mailings, and performing general administrative duties. The Publicity Assistant will work with a wide array of award-winning, bestselling books and novelists, journalists, and newsmakers, and is the ideal position for a curious, confident, self-motivated person who loves books across genres, has an understanding of the media, and is interested in learning how to execute publicity strategy.

Responding to a variety of calls from media, authors, and booksellers, and communicating between related in-house departments.
Handling detailed tour and media schedules for campaigns.
Coordinating travel and other essential arrangements for major author tours.
Coordinating and executing review copy mailings.
Gathering and organizing press clips.
Drafting publicity materials, including galley letters, press releases, and pitches.
Liaising with bookstores for author events.
Processing invoices, maintaining title budgets on supervisor’s campaigns, and helping with data entry related to department budgets.
Performing online research to acquire publicity contacts and updating media lists.
Coordinating logistics for meetings, including securing conference rooms, coordinating calendar schedules, preparing meeting materials, and taking notes.
Providing general administrative support, including answering phones, taking messages, photocopying, filing, expense reporting etc.

 Please apply if you meet the following minimum requirements:

Strong interest in book publishing, publicity and media relations, and in books across genres
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-starter who takes initiative
Ability to juggle priorities in a deadlines-driven environment
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Outlook and Excel, internet research

Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children’s publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 250 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children’s Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.

Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Company: Penguin Random House LLC
Country: United States of America
State/Region: New York
City: New York

MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:

Please note division and function examples are representative of opportunities common for this skill-set. The list is not exhaustive, and availability of open roles is determined based on business need. Specific roles will be confirmed through the interview process.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:

Whether it is developing product roadmaps or creating compelling content, colleagues that focus on product management and marketing drive the development, launch, and continuous promotion of our products and offerings. Through their work, they act as consultative partners to our businesses, evaluate products and develop strategic communication plans targeted to audiences.

Product management and marketing teams across the firm operate with creative and strategic thinking, and excellent writing and project management skills.

Divisions and Job Functions

Consumer externally known as Marcus by Goldman Sachs, is comprised of the firm’s digitally-led consumer businesses, which include our deposits and lending businesses, as well as our personal financial management app, Clarity Money. Consumer combines the strength and heritage of a 150-year-old financial institution with the agility and entrepreneurial spirit of a tech start-up. Through the use of machine learning and intuitive design, we provide customers with powerful tools that are grounded in value, transparency and simplicity to help them make smarter decisions about their money. Example teams seeking product management and/or marketing skills:
Acquisition Marketing develops campaigns across all digital channels and analyzes performance of campaigns for optimization
Customer Marketing & Engagement team is responsible for driving customer satisfaction, on-time payments, retention, and growth through omni-channel customer marketing campaigns and partnering across the organization to deliver exceptional customer experiences
Product Management defines and executes product strategy roadmap for Consumer business
 Merchant Banking Alternatives Capital Markets and Strategy Group is accountable for driving institutional capital markets, capital raising, and client strategy for alternative investments throughout Goldman Sachs. Focused on enhancing how we serve our investing clients, this group leads the coordination and expansion of the firm’s engagements in alternatives, across both direct investing strategies and open-architecture strategies. The group also collaborates with the firm’s investment teams to design alternative investment products and manage strategic partnerships. Working together with our institutional client relationship teams around the world, the group helps to centrally organize portfolio solutions and provide market insights and thought leadership to enhance our client interactions, communications and branding initiatives in alternative investments.

Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM) Product Teams are responsible for managing client interactions across the investment businesses. These responsibilities include identifying and researching prospective investors, analyzing the role of investments in a client’s portfolio, and working with clients and the investment teams to develop unique solutions. Analysts support the team’s client interactions through the development and production of marketing materials, analysis and review of client portfolios, collection and analysis of relevant market data, as well as participation in strategic initiatives.

Divisional Brand and Content Strategy Teams develop and implement global marketing campaigns and strategic initiatives that drive sales, client retention, and/or brand, inclusive of media and internal communications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree (2017 – December 2019)
0-3 years of prior work experience in a relevant field
Proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Strong ability to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines
Team player with positive attitude and strong work ethic
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Strong quantitative and analytical skills; investment acumen required for some roles
Candidates must demonstrate an ability to effectively communicate and present results highlighting the broader commercial and strategic impact
Candidates should be comfortable developing relationships throughout the firm and building networks within the division as well as with other divisions
Demonstrated ability to think creatively, strategically, and operationally with a commercial mindset
Ability to understand, dissect and analyze data to drive decisions and/or make recommendations
Strong problem-solving and project management skills
Strong communicator who can effectively gain alignment up, down and across teams
Strong project-management skills
Expertise in project plan management, strong understanding of key performance metrics and drivers
Exposure to the launch and management of products
Product strategy experience preferred for Consumer roles
Experience or awareness of AGILE methodology considered a plus for Consumer roles
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.


We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.


We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

Job Description
The Marketing Operations Director will oversee the program management, product management, performance management, social media management, finance, legal, production process and distribution operations for the creative department. The optimal candidate is obsessed with the ever-changing nature of the media landscape and is determined to drive revenue for The Washington Post by delighting advertising clients and readers alike with creative advertising experiences across platforms, products, and media types that drive ROI for our partners. You are an experienced client services expert with a nuanced understanding of the media business model.
Responsibilities include:
Oversee the program management team as they manage campaigns across categories and media types, providing optimal client service that drives renewals.
Manage a growing Performance Management team dedicated to monitoring and optimizing branded content programs across The Washington Post and distributed platforms to achieve client objectives.
Oversee a Social Media Management team dedicated to creating, executing and optimizing first-class social media initiatives across platforms.
Manage P&L for the creative team, coordinating directly with the Finance department, the Business Intelligence department, Client Services Management, and the VP Marketing and Branded Content to forecast, monitor and manage revenue and expenses on a monthly basis.
Collaborate cross functionally to establish optimized workflow and strategic packaging strategies for branded content media plans, leveraging performance best practices and budgeting/pricing insights, where applicable.
Work collaboratively across the department to development operations for BrandStudio backend support and frontend custom content protocol.
Manage and optimize processes to ensure operational effectiveness, including:
Identifying and implementing new program management processes and tools for all BrandStudio teams; optimizing processes and tools for effectiveness, as needed
Creating and monitoring workflow protocol, contracts and onboarding with freelancers and vendors to ensure seamless planning and execution of branded content programs on the pre- and post-sale side
Working with BrandStudio to establish and roll out custom creative pricing guidelines and production/legal parameters for all branded content initiatives

job_descriptions.34f2d937425d9109:
Who we are:

Unite Us is reinventing the delivery of health and human services. We connect service providers on a common platform, enabling scalable, accountable and measurable delivery of wraparound care. Our technology provides the collaborative infrastructure for these communities. We care deeply about the work we do and the communities our software benefits. We're looking for people to join our team who share that passion for our mission to reinvent Health & Human Services and aspire to make a lasting difference for future generations. No matter how large our team grows, we will always be family. Unite Us prides itself on offering a competitive salary, full benefits, and the opportunity to change the world. Come to Unite Us and together we can build healthier communities for everyone.

Description:

We are looking for an entry-level, methodical and creative Marketing Coordinator. This coordinator will work with our Marketing Manager to support the Marketing department with delivering marketing initiatives. You'll gain hands-on experience working with a fast-paced team to support a growing and expanding technology startup. This coordinator will have the opportunity to amplify social media marketing (paid, owned, and earned), support the execution of lead generation campaigns, and monitor our growing media strategy.

What You'll Do:

Write compelling copy, create graphics, and schedule posts for social media, coordinate a robust social calendar using approved publishing tools
Research and coordinator industry events and internal campaign milestones to support to the content team
Contribute in brainstorming digital tactics for lead generation campaigns
Present monthly departmental updates on all projects, working with each team member to gather data and analytics
Support marketing strategy activities and advertising campaigns on direction of the Marketing Manager

Who You Are:

Always willing to pitch in and help –no task is too small
You have experience with social media, marketing and/or communications
You're a strong and dependable writer, proof-reader, and editor
You thrive on managing multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
Details and deadlines matter to you and you know how to manage your time well

Environmental Job Requirements & Working Conditions:

This position is based in NYC (but is currently remote, due to COVID-19)

Unite Us is committed to building a diverse team and fostering an inclusive culture, and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and encourage our employees' differences in race, religion, color, national origin, gender, family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, disability, pregnancy, medical conditions, and other characteristics
job_descriptions.add2e910d72c886a:
Overview

Manage, produce and coordinate internal communications for Flight Operations to drive two-way communication cohesively between Flight Operations and the broader Atlas community and provide information all department team members need to do their jobs more effectively.


Responsibilities

Lead the creation and execution of a multi-channel communications plan for Flight Operations that elevates Atlas Air as a destination employer with key audiences including employees, potential employees, and business partners.
Proactively provide communications counsel that engages and supports Crewmembers and Flight Operations support personnel.
Support Flight Operations leadership by developing and coordinating content for various departmental communications channels including:
Crew Town Halls
Department videos
SVP Flight Line Briefings
Chief Pilot Updates
Presentations for key department events such as Captain Leadership and Check Airmen meetings
CBA negotiations updates including 5Y site
InsideAtlas
Industry award submissions
Assess existing crew feedback channels and make recommendations for improvements so that two-way communications are consistent and timely.
Help facilitate company-wide or crew-wide communications needs set forth by key leaders in Safety, Training and Travel and Crew Scheduling.
Produce and maintain a calendar of communications priorities, and action plans to support the communication plan.
Develop original content to propel the company's narrative, including, but not limited to, InsideAtlas, news releases, social posts, executive talking points, award submissions, blogs infographics and videos.
Identify and support external communications efforts to promote pilot careers.
Ongoing coordination with Corporate and Internal Communications to ensure alignment in message, and timing.
Assist with the company's crisis communications activities.
Lead the internal communications strategy and execution including crew-wide meeting planning, town halls, digital communications
Support Operations Executives and others on announcements, function and program communications
Manage and monitor the company's interests in key crew bases including CVG, JFK, MIA and ANC.


Qualifications

Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in English or Journalism preferred
5-7+ years of relevant work experience
Significant related work experience that includes writing in fields such as journalism, communications, or aviation.
Proficiency in strategic communications planning
Proficiency in project management
PR and media relations experience preferred

Special demands:

Typically requires overnight travel 10% to 20% of the time.

Skills:

Excellent writing and communications skills; strong and impactful storytelling approach.
Ability to synthesize complex and sensitive materials into compelling and persuasive content that will engage intended audiences.
Ability to think strategically and build project plans.
Ability to research issues and develop logical and practical solutions within the policies and procedures of the organization.
